title: Information Security Officer
description:
**About Anyfin**
 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to challenge the status quo, lowering interest rates, removing unnecessary fees, and helping people take control of their finances. With more than a million app downloads across Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Germany, we've helped hundreds of thousands of people save money.
   

  

 We recently obtained our banking license, which means new opportunities and new responsibilities. We're looking for someone to own security and help us meet regulatory requirements (including DORA) without drowning in bureaucracy.
   

  

**Your mission**
 This is a hands-on generalist role where you’ll own Anyfin’s security posture across governance, technical security, and operations. But you won’t do it in isolation, you’ll have support from legal, compliance, and engineering. Your job is to coordinate, drive, and make sure things actually happen.
   

  

 Some areas require your depth (security governance, technical security practices). Other areas require you to coordinate and oversee (incident response, vendor security, training). We’re looking for someone who’s comfortable with that mix and pragmatic about where to focus.
   

  

 This is
 **not** 
 a “build a security empire” role. It’s roll-up-your-sleeves work: drafting policies that make sense, running access reviews, helping out in GCP, and making sure we’re genuinely secure and not just compliant on paper.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 Security is a top priority for Anyfin right now, not “someday”. With a banking license in place and new regulatory requirements (including DORA), this role will be central to making sure we scale in a secure, resilient, and pragmatic way.
   

  

 You’ll own and drive the full security agenda across three core areas:
   

  

* Governance & compliance (done pragmatically)


 You’ll Make Sure We Have The Right Foundations In Place Such As Policies, Routines, Documentation, And Reporting Without Creating Unnecessary Overhead. This Includes
   

  

* Drafting and maintaining security policies, instructions, and routines that meet both operational and regulatory requirements
* Internal and external reporting
* Staying on top of DORA and relevant frameworks (with support from legal/compliance)
* Maintaining the Registry of Information and supporting risk assessments, including NPAP
* Preparing for and following up on audits
* Technical security (not just compliance on paper)


 You’ll Work Closely With Engineering To Ensure Our Security Practices Are Real, Working, And Continuously Improving, Not Something That Just Looks Good In a Document. This Includes
   

  

* Making sure we’re actually secure, not just compliant
* Defining and enforcing technical security practices together with engineering
* Helping implement changes where needed (hands-on when it matters)
* Supporting or owning IAM and access administration
* Security operations (prepared, tested, and running)


 You’ll Coordinate The Operational Side Of Security And Make Sure We Stay On Top Of Risks, Incidents, And Third Parties As We Grow. This Includes
   

  

* Running access reviews and ensuring follow-up and remediation
* Commissioning penetration tests, reviewing results, and making sure findings are addressed
* Operational support on ICT risks, including risk assessments
* Leading incident response when things go wrong — and making sure we’re prepared before they do
* Driving security awareness and building a security-conscious culture
* Overseeing vendor and supply chain security assessments
* Supporting business continuity and disaster recovery planning
* Providing training


**What We're Looking For**
 We’re looking for someone with 5–8 years of experience in security roles and a strong technical foundation (security engineering, DevSecOps, infrastructure security, or similar). You have hands-on cloud security experience (GCP preferred) and are familiar with security frameworks such as ISO 27001, SOC 2, or similar.
   

  

 You’re able to translate regulatory requirements into pragmatic processes that work in the real world, and you communicate clearly and confidently across the organisation. You’re also comfortable being a generalist and the only dedicated ICT security person, while still believing that security is everyone’s responsibility here.
   

  

**Nice to have:** 
 experience in financial services or with DORA/EBA guidelines, experience with Google Cloud Security Command Center, and the ability to read and review code.
   

  

**Why Anyfin?**
* A real challenge: help a newly licensed bank get security right during a critical growth phase
* Autonomy and ownership — no security theatre, just meaningful work
* A collaborative culture where security is seen as an enabler, not a blocker
* Competitive compensation, a central Stockholm office, and the usual perks
* We work from the office in Stockholm four days a week


 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Junior Application Support Specialist
description:
**Är du i början av din karriär och söker en utvecklande roll inom Ekonomi och IT?** 
 Support-teamet på Kleer växer med ytterligare en kollega! I rollen som Junior Application Specialist får du arbeta i ett av bolagets mest centrala roller och vara den viktiga länken mellan såväl kunderna som företagets alla affärsområden. Vi söker dig som vill arbeta i gränslandet mellan Ekonomi & Tech och som vill utvecklas vidare inom båda områdena!
   

  

**💛 Varför Kleer?**
 Kleer är ett framåtlutat FaaS-bolag som kombinerar marknadens mest automatiserade ekonomisystem med en tillhörande tjänsteleverans som stöttar kunderna med det som bara en människa kan göra. Vi har fått utmärkelsen DI Gasell sex år i rad och är ett värderingsstyrt bolag med stort fokus på ansvar, glädje, prestigelöshet och nyfikenhet! Vi är ca 200 kollegor idag med kontor i centrala Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder ett utvecklande jobb med frihet under ansvar, balans mellan arbete & fritid, bra förmåner, interna karriärmöjligheter, kompetensutveckling och kul aktiviteter som konferenser och AW’s, ett modernt och centralt kontor fullt av hjälpsamma, prestigelösa och kunniga kollegor, och mycket mer.
   

  

**👉🏼 Din Roll Som Junior Application Specialist**
 Vi söker nu en driven och nyfiken junior applikationsspecialist för att ansluta till vårt support team. Rollen kommer att fokusera på att stötta våra kunder med expertis kring applikationen. Vi erbjuder en fantastisk möjlighet för dig som är i början av karriären och vill utvecklas inom både ekonomi och IT.
   

  

**Rollen Innefattar Följande Arbetsuppgifter**
* Ta emot och hantera förfrågningar från kunder angående teknisk support för vårt ekonomisystem genom ärendehanteringssystem och telefon.
* Analysera och lösa tekniska problem både självständigt och tillsammans med seniora teammedlemmar samt utvecklare.
* Dokumentera och rapportera supportärenden för framtida referens och förbättring.
* Samarbeta med teamet för att implementera förbättringar och lära dig bästa praxis inom supportprocessen.


 Vi ser gärna att du längre fram vill lära dig skapa rapporter och widgets till våra kunder med hjälp av SQL samt kunna stötta kunder när de önskar sätta upp integrationer med vår applikation.
   

  

**👀 Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i rollen söker vi dig med ett stort intresse för teknik, problemlösning och ekonomi samt en stark vilja att leverera enastående service till våra kunder. Vi ser att du är i inledningen av din karriär, troligtvis har du nyligen eller för något år sedan tagit din examen inom relevant område (exempelvis Ekonomi/IT/Systemvetenskap).
   

  

**Vidare Tror Vi Att Du Har**
* Stark känsla för att ge support och nyfikenhet för kundens problem.
* Grundläggande kunskap om datorsystem, nätverk och applikationer.
* Starka problemlösningsförmågor.
* Du har utmärkta kommunikationsförmågor både i svenska och engelska såväl i tal som i skrift.
* Flexibilitet och förmåga att hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt.


 ⭐️ Det är meriterande om du även har erfarenhet, kunskap och utbildning inom:
   

  

* Att ta emot och hantera inkommande telefonsamtal
* Skriva SQL-satser
* Förstår hur API:er fungerar och kan göra anrop med hjälp av Postman


**Vår Rekryteringsprocess**
 På Kleer tycker vi det är viktigt med en transparent och rättvis rekryteringsprocess. Vi använder oss av assessmentmetoder från Alva Labs i rekryteringsprocessen för att hjälpa oss på ett objektivt tillvägagångssätt identifiera kandidater med störst sannolikhet att trivas och passa i rollen. Utöver rekryteringstester genomför vi bakgrundskontroller och referenstagning i slutskedet av processen. Det som avgör vilka kandidater som går vidare i processen är tjänstens kravprofil. Vårt mål är att hitta den bästa matchningen – och vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig! 💛
   

  

 Vi ser verkligen fram emot din ansökan och kommer att gå igenom urvalet löpande, så vänta inte med att höra av dig!
   

  

 Tilltänkt start: Enligt överenskommelse. Ort: Denna tjänst är med utgångspunkt från kontoret i Centrala Stockholm (Fleminggatan 14)
   

  

 Se mer om oss på: https://karriar.kleer.se/ & instagram.com/kleer\_group
   

  

 Kleer är ekonomi- och lönehantering för moderna SaaS- och konsultbolag. Vi kombinerar Sveriges mest automatiserade ekonomisystem med ett dedikerat ekonomiteam. Resultatet: finansiell kontroll i realtid, minimal administration och en ekonomi som driver affären – inte bara rapporterar om den.
   

  

 Vi har utsetts till DI Gasell sju gånger och är stolta över vår värderingsstyrda kultur som bygger på ansvar, glädje, nyfikenhet och prestigelöshet. Idag är vi cirka 200 medarbetare med kontor i centrala Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö.

title: Business Development Representative - Nordics - V.I.E
description:
**OUR STORY:**
 🇪🇺 Join Scaleway and shape the sovereign cloud of tomorrow !
   

  

 Since 1999, we have been designing secure, sustainable infrastructures aimed at supporting the most ambitious companies.
   

  

 Historically known for our dedicated servers (Dedibox), we made a strategic shift to cloud computing in 2015. Staying true to our principles of simplicity, flexibility, and technical excellence, we have become one of the leading players in Europe in the sector.
   

  

 With the rise of artificial intelligence, we have strengthened our commitment, supported by the Iliad Group, which is investing €3 billion to develop a serious, sovereign AI alternative to American and Asian giants.
   

  

 Every day, thanks to our fast-growing portfolio of cloud and AI products (bare metal, containerization, serverless, AI, etc.), Scaleway proudly serves thousands of customer across the private and public sector, from corporations like France Télévisions or Hachette Livre, to fast-growing startups like Photoroom and Biolevate, to institutions like the City of Copenhagen.
   

  

 📍 Our offices are located in
 **Paris, Lille, Toulouse, Rennes, Rouen, Bordeaux and Lyon.**
**WHY WE NEED YOU?**
 Our growth in the Nordics region is driving us to strengthen our Sales team to accelerate strategic outbound prospection and expand our footprint across Sweden and neighboring markets.
   

  

 Your mission will be to generate qualified opportunities through targeted outbound and inbound prospection in order to fuel pipeline growth and support our Account Executives in closing high-value cloud deals.
   

  

**YOUR FUTURE TEAM**
 We work in a collaborative and international environment where the diversity of
   

  

 Scalers, combined with a spirit of sharing, helps bring new projects to life every day,
   

  

 advancing our ambitions together.
   

  

 You will be part of a team of 8 people composed of a Manager, a Team Lead, and
   

  

 Business Development Representatives working closely with Account Executives.
   

  

 Each BDR operates in a duo with an Account Executive, targeting around 200 strategic accounts.
   

  

 The team works collectively on cold calling sessions, outbound campaigns, account
   

  

 mapping, and continuous training initiatives. With 80% of the team currently on
   

  

 target, the culture is performance-driven, supportive, and highly collaborative.
   

  

 Manager information: Orlando Bocaly
   

  

**YOUR DAILY ROUTINE**
 Tasks
   

  

 Identify and prospect strategic target accounts in the Nordics region (mainly Sweden)
   

  

 Execute cold calling, cold emailing, and outbound campaigns
   

  

 Run structured prospection plans to reach and exceed monthly targets
   

  

 Map accounts and identify key stakeholders and decision-makers
   

  

 Qualify inbound leads and generate new outbound opportunities
   

  

 Work closely in duo with Account Executives to build pipeline
   

  

 Collaborate with Sales Architects to refine value propositions
   

  

 Use tools such as Salesforce, Outreach, Lusha, Humanlinker, Gmail,
   

  

 Scaleway internal tools, and Confluence
   

  

 Participate in team prospecting sessions, events, and regional initiatives
   

  

 Track performance metrics and continuously optimize outreach strategies
   

  

**About You**
**HARDSKILLS :**
 At least 1 year of experience as a Business Development Representative, Sales Development Representative, or Inside Sales Representative
   

  

 Proven experience in outbound prospection (cold calling, cold email, hunting)
   

  

 Knowledge of IT, SaaS, or Cloud environments (AI/cloud knowledge is a strong plus)
   

  

 Experience using sales tools such as Salesforce, Outreach, or similar CRM/prospecting platforms
   

  

 Ability to structure a prospection plan and manage a defined portfolio of target accounts
   

  

**SOFTSKILLS :**
 Strong hunting mindset with a results-driven approach
   

  

 Excellent communication and social skills, charismatic and easy to talk to
   

  

 Target-oriented with a clear understanding of KPIs and performance metrics
   

  

 Resilient and comfortable with high-volume outbound activity
   

  

 Fluent in Swedish, English and French
   

  

 🚀
 **Why join the Scaleway adventure?**
 ✔ A rich and diverse product offering: Scaleway offers over 100 public cloud
   

  

 products in IaaS, PaaS, and AI.
   

  

 ✔ A cutting-edge technical environment: Scaleway provides modern infrastructures,
   

  

 including high-performance bare metal servers, to tackle exciting technical
   

  

 challenges.
   

  

 ✔ Commitment to responsible cloud: Scaleway is dedicated to a more responsible
   

  

 cloud, with data centers powered solely by renewable energy since 2017, minimizing
   

  

 our ecological footprint and holding top-level certification.
   

  

 Additionally for this role :
   

  

 Join a leading European cloud provider expanding in the Nordics
   

  

 Attractive commission structure with strong earning potential
   

  

 A high-performing team (80% on target)
   

  

 Opportunities to attend industry events across the region
   

  

 A strong, supportive, and performance-driven team culture
   

  

 🔜
 **THE NEXT STEPS …**
 HR screening with our Talent Acquisition team (30 min)
   

  

 Interview with Orlando Bocaly, Hiring Manager, to understand your experience
   

  

 and approach to prospection (45 min)
   

  

 Role play and practical case (including video answers) to validate your
   

  

 expertise (1h)
   

  

 Interview with the Head of BDR and an Account Executive to deepen
   

  

 discussions and assess team fit (45 min)
   

  

 Final discussion with the CSO and office visit to meet your future colleagues
   

  

*At Scaleway, we are committed to building an inclusive and respectful workplace where everyone has a fair opportunity to thrive.*
*All applications are considered with care, regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, ethnic or social background, religion, disability, or any other characteristic.*
*We believe great ideas come from everywhere, and everyone which is why you should definitely apply.*

title: BI Analyst
description:
**Why Join Us?** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
 



  





 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As a
 **BI Analyst** 
 at Dynavox Group, you’ll step into a broad and dynamic role within our global BI & Analytics team, where you will empower the organization with high-quality data and insights across all business areas. Your mission is to transform data into knowledge and knowledge into action, enabling data-driven decisions that move Tobii Dynavox forward.
 



  





 The Business Intelligence team is responsible for the BI data estate including operating and developing an enterprise data warehouse, front end reports and semantic models as well as to continuously adapt to a changing catalogue of source systems and business requirements.
 



  





 In this broad role, you’ll help our business teams make data-driven decisions,
 **improve processes** 
 , and gain insights into both internal performance and customer behaviour. You’ll also work with
 **data modelling** 
 and
 **front-end reporting** 
 to deliver meaningful insights to the organization.
 



  





**Please note:** 
 This is a
 **hybrid** 
 role based in
 **Stockholm, Sweden** 
 .
 



  





**In this role you will:** 



* Support the development and improvement of our BI data estate, with a focus on user experience and solution coherence.
* Collaborate with business teams to gather requirements and deliver meaningful reports and dashboards.
* Analyse internal performance data and expand into external customer usage insights.
* Participate in projects that integrate new information areas into our BI systems.
* Conduct training and help stakeholders understand and use data effectively.
* Contribute to front-end reporting and support project coordination.
* Work cross-functionally with teams across the organization.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




 If you're curious about business processes, enjoy using data to solve problems and support decision-making, and thrive in collaborative environments focused on continuous improvement — we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





**We’re looking for a proactive and business-oriented individual with:** 



* Educational background in Business Administration, Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields.
* Prior experience in roles such as BI Consultant, BI Analyst, Management Consultant.
* Proficiency in
 **Excel** 
 with experience in
 **data extraction** 
 and experience with business intelligence tools and visualization platforms (i.e. Power BI).
* Strong communication skills as well as adaptability, eagerness to learn, and ability to take initiatives proactively to work closely with stakeholders across various levels and functions.
* Proficiency in both spoken and written communication in English. Proficiency in Swedish is a highly valued.
* Experience with SQL and data warehouse automation tools is a plus.
* Familiarity and interest in in programming languages such as SQL, DAX and M is a plus.



  





**Our Values:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
 



  





**What We Offer:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
 


* **Purpose-Driven Work:** 
 Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* **“Yes, and...” Flexibility:** 
 Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* **Growth and Development:** 
 Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* **Inclusive and Supportive Culture:** 
 Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* **A Global Leader with Heart:** 
 Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Data Scientist
description:
We are expanding our
 **Data & ML** 
 team with an additional
 **Data Scientist** 
 focusing on
 **marketing** 
 . We have already created significant value from ML across several areas, but see clear untapped potential in applying it more deeply within marketing to improve ROI. We are now looking for a Data Scientist who will focus on marketing and drive measurable business impact through close collaboration with marketing teams across our markets.
 



  





**What you will do** 



* Build, deploy, and improve machine learning models that optimize marketing performance across markets.
* Apply ML to improve bidding efficiency, attribution, and CRM effectiveness.
* Partner with marketers and business developers as a trusted advisor to drive ROI through effective use of ML.
* Ensure models are production-ready and deliver measurable, continuous business value.
* Design, analyze, and interpret MMM, experiments, and causal analyses to guide marketing investment decisions.
* Identify and prioritize new opportunities where ML can improve marketing efficiency.



  





**What you bring** 



* +3 years of experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar applied ML role.
* Good understanding of marketing use cases such as bidding optimization, attribution, and CRM.
* Proven ability to collaborate closely with marketing teams to drive measurable business results with data and ML.
* Takes initiative to identify, shape, and drive ML opportunities end-to-end, from idea to measurable business impact.
* Proven experience designing and interpreting MMM or incrementality tests to guide marketing investment decisions.
* Strong modeling expertise, with deep knowledge of statistical and machine learning methods, including when and how to apply them in a marketing context.
* Strong Python programming skills.



  





**Very nice to have** 



* Deep understanding of how ad bidding algorithms work and how machine learning can be used to influence, complement, or optimize them.
* Experience deploying, running, and monitoring machine learning models in production using a modern tech stack (e.g. Kubernetes, GCP, ArgoCD).
* Enjoy working at the intersection of business, data, and engineering.



  





 We believe great people do their best work when they’re trusted. That’s why we offer high autonomy, real ownership and clear accountability. You’ll help create measurable business impact through machine learning in a core growth area, while collaborating with a strong, supportive Data & ML team that values well-being, technical excellence and continuous improvement. You’ll work with a modern tech stack, including production ML systems and generative AI tools, supported by competitive compensation and a flexible hybrid setup.

title: Spontanansökan – IT-infrastrukturkonsult till Nexer Infrastructure
description:
Detta gäller inte ett specifikt uppdrag, utan framtida möjligheter vid rätt matchning.
   

  

 Är du nyfiken på nästa steg inom IT-infrastruktur?
   

  

 Vi på Nexer Infrastructure söker löpande kontakt med skickliga och engagerade personer inom IT-infrastruktur – även om vi just nu inte har ett aktivt uppdrag att tillsätta. Vi vet ännu inte exakt vilka uppdrag som kommer in i höst – men genom att skicka in en spontanansökan finns du med i våra tankar när vi söker rätt kompetens för framtida uppdrag. Så kikar du runt efter nya utmaningar och är intresserad av Nexer - skicka gärna in din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi är särskilt intresserade av dig som har erfarenhet inom något/några av områdena nedan:
   

  

* Drift, övervakning och förvaltning av IT-miljöer
* Nätverk, brandväggar och säkerhetslösningar
* Linux (Automatisering i Ansible eller Bash)
* Microsoftmiljöer (AD, Exchange, M365, Windows Server)
* Virtualisering (VMware, Hyper-V)
* Molntjänster (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud)
* ITIL och arbete med ärendehanteringssystem


 Vem är du?
   

  

 Du har flera års erfarenhet inom IT-infrastruktur och är van att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du har ett konsultmässigt förhållningssätt, kommunicerar tydligt och gillar problemlösning.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

* Förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya miljöer
* God problemlösningsförmåga och vana att arbeta proaktivt
* Obehindrade kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift


 Vad kan vi erbjuda?
   

  

 Hos oss blir du en del av ett bolag med passion, framtidstro och teknik i fokus. När rätt uppdrag dyker upp matchar vi dig med det – och stöttar dig hela vägen, både inför och under uppdraget.
   

  

 Du får ett starkt nätverk av kollegor, en engagerad konsultchef och chansen att göra skillnad ute hos våra kunder.
   

  

 Låter det intressant?
   

  

 Skicka in ditt CV och några rader om din kompetens, tillgänglighet och vilken typ av uppdrag du är intresserad av. Vi återkommer efter semestrarna om vi får in ett uppdrag som matchar din profil.

title: Head of Platforms and Core Services
description:
**Head of Platforms & Core Services**
**Location:** 
 Vingcard – ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions
   

  

**Industry:** 
 Access Solutions & Connected Technologies
   

  

 At ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions, part of the global ASSA ABLOY Group, we imagine new ways people move through a safer, more open world every single day. From automatic doors and hotel locks to border control solutions — chances are, you’ve already used our technology without even realizing it. With operations in over 70 countries and more than 52,000 colleagues worldwide, we lead the way in secure, seamless access experiences.
   

  

 Within our Vingcard business, we now have an exceptional opportunity for an experienced technology leader to join us as
 **Head of Platforms & Core Services** 
 .
   

  

**Your Impact**
 As Head of Platforms & Core Services, you will play a pivotal role in building, shaping, and governing the shared technology platforms that power all product units across our portfolio. Reporting directly to the CTO, you define the platform vision that enables scale, accelerates product innovation, ensures interoperability, and supports the integration of acquired businesses.
   

  

 You will architect the foundations—platforms, data, integration frameworks, security principles—that allow our teams to move faster, integrate effectively, and deliver a coherent ecosystem to customers around the world.
   

  

 This is a deeply technical, architecture‑led leadership role at the center of a global enterprise that continues to grow through innovation and acquisition.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities** 
**Platform & Architecture Leadership**
* Define and evolve the enterprise platform strategy across cloud, data, integration, and shared services.
* Own reference architectures, architectural standards, and governing technical principles across product domains.
* Act as senior solution architect for complex cross‑brand or cross‑product initiatives.
* Ensure platform decisions balance scalability, security, resilience, and long‑term maintainability.


**Business Integration & M&A Technology Roadmaps** 
  

  

* Own the technology integration strategy for acquired companies.
* Build and maintain rolling technology roadmaps covering:
+ Platform migration of acquired products and teams
+ Decommissioning of legacy systems

* Contribute to technical due diligence for future acquisitions.
* Establish repeatable integration patterns to accelerate M&A activity.


**Integration & Interoperability**
* Own API, middleware, and event‑driven integration standards.
* Enable seamless interoperability across product units and with hotel ecosystems (PMS, BMS, GRMS, and third‑party systems).
* Govern integration frameworks to ensure a coherent, unified solution landscape.


**Data, Analytics & Intelligence Enablement**
* Own shared data platforms, pipelines, and foundational analytics infrastructure.
* Enable AI, predictive analytics, and data‑driven innovation through robust governance.
* Ensure data quality, consistency, and appropriate access controls across domains.


**Security, Compliance & Technical Governance**
* Own security architecture, identity frameworks, and access management principles.
* Define and drive secure‑by‑design and privacy‑by‑design standards.
* Lead technical compliance programs (ISO, SOC, GDPR) with security and legal partners.
* Contribute to architecture and governance forums across the enterprise.


**Skills & Experience**
 You bring:
   

  

* Senior leadership experience in platform architecture, distributed systems, and integration‑heavy environments.
* A proven track record steering large‑scale system integration and platform consolidation programs.
* Deep expertise in cloud‑native architectures, data platforms, and API‑led ecosystems.
* Experience integrating acquired businesses into shared enterprise platforms.
* Strong understanding of security architecture, governance, and compliance frameworks in complex B2B settings.
* Natural authority and credibility with senior engineers, architects, and technical leaders.
* Ability to influence effectively across a matrix organization without direct line management.


**Leadership Attributes**
* Systems thinker with long‑term architectural vision
* Pragmatic, outcome‑oriented decision‑maker
* Technically credible, calm, and authoritative
* Able to balance product team autonomy with enterprise coherence
* Strong communicator in complex cross‑functional environments


**What You Can Expect From Us**
* A competitive and comprehensive total rewards package
* Career development resources designed to help you grow and advance
* Supportive, accessible leadership and a values‑driven culture
* The impact and reach of an innovative, global industry leader
* The opportunity to shape the future of secure digital access worldwide


**Application**
 Interested candidates can apply by clicking
 **Apply Now** 
 .
   

  

 Please note: we can only consider applications submitted through the online application system.
   

  

**About ASSA ABLOY**
 ASSA ABLOY has been listed four times among Forbes’ World’s Most Innovative Companies . We create safe, convenient, and intelligent access solutions that bring real value to our customers. Our technologies support billions of people in experiencing a more open world every day. With leading market positions across Europe, the Americas, Asia, and Oceania, our solutions span the entire spectrum of entrance and access requirements — from locks and doors to advanced automation and digital access ecosystems.
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Country Manager Sweden
description:
Paula’s Choice, a global skincare leader that empowers individuals to define beauty on their own terms through science-backed products. We are an ambitious fast-growing brand with an inspiring mission: we uncover the truth about skincare and deliver smart, safe products based on scientific research, without gimmicks and misleading claims. Part of Unilever Prestige Brands since 2021, our mission comes to life through four core values that guide our actions, decisions, and impact:
 



  




* **Build Trust:** 
 We set the standard for skincare, transparency, and shared knowledge.



  




* **Be Bold:** 
 We lead through innovation and by challenging the status quo.



  




* **Act with Kindness:** 
 We operate with respect and care—for our customers, colleagues, and the planet.



  




* **Create Community:** 
 We believe in the power of connection—whether educating customers, supporting each other, or giving back, we grow stronger together.



  





 Our Global Headquarters remains at the heart of the brand, where it was founded by Paula Begoun in 1995, Seattle. Our European headquarters are in the Netherlands and local offices in selected European countries like London, Berlin and Paris. We market our skincare via different business models: direct-to-consumer via our own websites, marketplaces and selected retail partners, including Sephora, Galeries Lafayette, Space NK, Douglas, Kicks and many more.
 



  





 We’re a rapidly growing entrepreneurial team that thrives on change, prioritising a culture of feedback and inclusivity. Our culture encourages continuous learning and is fuelled by connection, curiosity, and cross-functional collaboration.
 



  





 Paula’s Choice is committed to diversity! Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for empowering people to achieve their own definition of beautiful, Paula’s Choice could be a wonderful fit for you.
 



  





 Paula’s Choice has ambitious growth goals in Sweden! To help bring our brand and business in Sweden to the next level of growth, we are looking for a
 



  





**Country Manager Sweden | Full- time | Stockholm** 




  





 As Country Manager, you will lead and organize your local team to accelerate the Swedish business by unlocking untapped potential for Paula’s Choice.
 



  





 With a strong focus on new customers, you will search for opportunities in your main areas of responsibility: organic social, influencer & community relations, local events/marketing campaigns, local partnerships, education, PR and key account management. You will be our eyes and ears in the Swedish market. Always up to date with the latest novities. Know what is hot and not! You will bring latest local insights on beauty, digital marketing and E-commerce to the central European Hub in Amersfoort, The Netherlands.
 



  





 Your team in Stockholm will consist of a Skincare Education Manager, Field Sales Representative, Content & Copy Writer and Customer Care employee(s). We have a local office in the middle of Stockholm!
 



  





 You and your team will closely collaborate with our European Marketing & E-commerce team in the Netherlands, who are responsible across markets for strategy and execution of online marketing, Paula’s Choice websites/e-commerce, retention, brand & creative, product marketing and marketplaces. They can only be successful with your insights and cooperation, same as you and your team can only be successful with their support.
 



  





 You are part of the Commerce team and will report to the Director Nordics & Business Development.
 



  





**What will you be doing?** 




  




* Pro-actively searching for white spaces and new opportunities to grow the Paula’s Choice business in Sweden, in line with the overall strategy.
* Owning your market: making use of multiple internal and external data sources to analyse and forecast performance, identify risks and opportunities and turn them into action.
* Manage budgets, forecasts and expenses for DTC, B2B, marketing and PR.
* Active networking to gain and maintain meaningful partnerships (influencers, community, education, PR) to grow the market position.
* Localizing and executing the global influencer & community playbook and keep track of KPI progress.
* 360 executing of the central European Marketing Calendar
* Working closely with your team as well as managing our external PR agency in Stockholm to significantly increase brand awareness and build the brand by unlocking untapped potential.
* Working closely with our Central teams to provide market input for Digital marketing, Brand, Retention and E-commerce.
* Providing market and business insights for the marketing strategy for the Swedish market. Help to translate into tactical plans and execute
* Manage our Key Accounts, initiate and execute activations to increase sell-out per door
* Creative thinking to maximize business value with a limited budget.



  





  





**What will you bring:** 




  




* Bachelor level education, within Marketing, Communication, or related field.
* Minimal 7-8 Years of experience in a comparable Commercial and Team-lead role. Experience in Key Account Management, E-commerce or Digital Marketing in the beauty/skincare market is a plus. Network in influencer community targeted under 30 is a plus.
* Result oriented, constantly looking for optimization and new opportunities.
* An entrepreneur and self-starter mentality.
* You are a team player, able to convince and activate others to accomplish the required results.
* Eager to learn and drive to always be up to date within your discipline.
* Native language Swedish and fluent in English, verbal as well as in writing.
* Willing to travel to our European Headquarters in the Netherlands (3-4 times per year).



  





 Do you recognize yourself in the above and do you enjoy working in a dynamic and informal work environment? Then we would love to get to know you and hopefully welcome you to join our enthusiastic team soon (yes, we move fast, also in our recruitment!).
 



  





 We look forward to receiving a motivation letter in English together with your Curriculum Vitae.

title: IT Sourcing & Procurement Manager
description:
**Be part of something bigger. Decode the future.**
 At Electrolux Group, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home.
   

  

**All about the role:**
 We are hiring an
 **IT Sourcing & Procurement Manager** 
 to join our Global IT Sourcing team. In this role, you will collaborate closely with both Global Indirect Purchasing and Global IT, supporting our
 **IT Services** 
 and
 **Software & Cloud** 
 categories. You will work with stakeholders across regions and global functions to understand demand, identify optimal sourcing solutions, and ensure high‑quality delivery of IT services and technologies.
   

  

 This position reports to the Director of the IT Sourcing unit.
   

  

**What you'll do:**
* Drive both operational and strategic purchasing activities across IT categories.
* Lead RFI, RFP, and RFQ processes, including commercial and contractual negotiations with IT suppliers.
* Lead and coordinate IT‑related procurement and vendor‑management projects, ensuring alignment with timelines, budgets, risks, and stakeholder expectations.
* Own and maintain sourcing‑related standards, purchasing processes, and governance practices.
* Monitor supplier performance and service quality through KPIs, SLAs, and regular business reviews.
* Support monthly purchasing, supplier, and contract‑lifecycle reporting.
* Prepare and administer contract changes, amendments, and consolidations.
* Ensure compliance with Electrolux policies, standards, and legal frameworks.
* Serve as an escalation point for commercial vendor issues.
* Identify new opportunities with existing and potential suppliers.


**Qualifications and requirements:**
* Experienced in IT procurement, software sourcing, cloud services, and telecom/outsourcing agreements.
* Skilled in IT contract management, service descriptions, and cloud/software SLAs.
* Strong project management capability—able to structure, plan, and drive projects from initiation to completion.
* Proficient in managing complex stakeholder environments across global and functional boundaries.
* Comfortable using Microsoft 365; experience with SAP Ariba and ServiceNow is a plus.
* A relationship builder with a strong “can‑do” attitude.
* Analytical, results‑driven, and collaborative.
* Clear in communication, strong in negotiation, and effective in time management.
* Proven ability to drive quality, efficiency, and cost reductions through effective purchasing and vendor‑management techniques.


**Where you'll be:**
 This is a position based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden).
   

  

 We are proud of our culture of inclusivity and diversity. At our Global Headquarters we have 60+ nationalities working together for our common goals. You will be part of this dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.

title: BI Developer
description:
**About WPP Media**
 WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients and communities. For more information, visit wpp.com.
   

  

 WPP Media is WPP’s global media collective. In a world where media is everywhere and in everything, we bring the best platform, people, and partners together to create limitless opportunities for growth. For more information, visit wppmedia.com.
   

  

**Role**
 At WPP Media, we believe in the power of our culture and our people. It’s what elevates us to deliver exceptional experiences for both our clients and each other. In this role it will be critical to embrace WPP & WPP Media’s shared core values:
   

  

* Be Extraordinary by Leading Collectively to Inspire transformational Creativity.
* Create an Open environment by Balancing People and Client Experiences by Cultivating Trust.
* Lead Optimistically by Championing Growth and Development to Mobilize the Enterprise.


**Role Summary And Impact**
 As a BI Developer at WPP Media, you will build and maintain Power BI solutions that help our specialists and clients follow up on media performance. The role is centered around developing user-friendly dashboards, establishing robust data streams, and creating well-structured data models that enable reliable reporting at scale. You’ll translate business needs into technical BI solutions and work closely with engineers, Data Scientists, client teams, and customers - often integrating outputs from different measurement and analytics projects (e.g., MMM, attribution, and other studies) into clear, actionable reporting.
   

  

**Requirements**
**Skills and Experience**
* Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience) in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field
* Experience building and maintaining Power BI solutions, both independently and together with others
* Good knowledge of SQL
* Experience working in a cloud environment, preferably Google Cloud/BigQuery
* Understanding of how data flows and data models are set up to support stable reporting
* Swedish: good understanding in speech and writing
* English: fluent in speech and writing


**Meriting**
* Experience with data modeling and data integration
* Knowledge of DAXs and/or Python
* Experience from media/marketing environments (e.g., agency, publisher, platform)
* Knowledge of digital marketing and media measurement
* Experience working with or visualising outputs from measurement projects (e.g., MMM, attribution)


**Life At WPP Media & Benefits**
 Our passion for shaping the next era of media includes investing in our employees to help them do their best work, and we’re just as committed to employee growth as we are to responsible media investment. WPP Media employees can tap into the global WPP Media & WPP networks to pursue their passions, grow their networks, and learn at the cutting edge of marketing and advertising.
   

  

 In Sweden, our benefits include a SEK 3,000 wellness allowance, a 37,5-hour workweek, half-days and “klämdagar" off, 30 days of vacation, and two paid volunteer days per year. WPP Media Sweden is a member of Almega, and all employees are covered by a collective bargaining agreement (kollektivavtal), which ensures occupational pension, insurance, and other negotiated terms. We host regular team activities, knowledge-sharing sessions, and wellness initiatives throughout the year.
   

  

 WPP Media is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers. We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we’ve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office around four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.
   

  

**Application**
 This is a full-time permanent position with a start date as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period. In addition to reviewing your CV and conducting interviews, our recruitment process includes a testing phase. Selection and interviews are ongoing, so please submit your application with your CV and cover letter as soon as possible.
   

  

 We believe that diverse perspectives make us stronger and encourage applications from people of all genders, backgrounds, and experiences.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you have questions about the position, feel free to contact Viktor Åhlén, Head of Operations & Engineering viktor.ahlen@choreograph.com. Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications via email.
   

  

 Please read our Privacy Notice for more information on how we process the information you provide.

title: Digital Transformation Lead
description:
*BROMMA is a division of Kalmar, operating under its own brand. BROMMA has been the leading manufacturer of crane spreaders ever since its formation in the 1960s. Today we have, by far, the highest market share of the world’s spreader suppliers. Today, our spreaders are currently in use in 99 of the top-100 ports worldwide.*
*BROMMA sales and service network has a wide-reaching footprint. We are present with own sales offices on all continents, and with an extensive network of agents, we are able to support customers in every country in the world.*
*More information about BROMMA can be found on www.bromma.com*
**Join us and take your career to the next level**
 We are looking for a Digital Transformation Lead to join our team in Kista and play a pivotal role in shaping Bromma’s digital future. In this role, you will define and execute our digital strategy, ensuring that we remain at the forefront of the cargo handling industry through practical, scalable, and business-driven technology. This is not a purely strategic role — you will turn vision into action. You will lead the implementation of Bromma’s digital roadmap, take hands-on responsibility for the technical setup and development of our Information Management (IM) systems, and drive transformation initiatives from concept to execution.
   

  

 Reporting to the Director Digitalisation and Sustainability, you will operate with a high degree of autonomy while collaborating closely with external partners and teams across the organization. Your focus will be on shaping sustainable, forward-looking solutions that support how we work today and position us for the future.
   

  

**What Are Your Key Responsibilities**
 As the Digital Transformation Lead at Bromma, you will work closely with internal stakeholders and external vendors to:
   

  

* Manage and deliver IT projects, overseeing the full cycle from implementing new capabilities to the continuous development and upgrading of existing applications.
* Drive our data and analytics strategy through hands-on development, specifically building out new capabilities within the Google Cloud Platform (e.g., Data Studio and Connected Sheets).
* Refine and build data models to ensure better integration and smoother data flow across our global platforms and business processes.
* Implement and optimize AI-driven tools, focusing on practical applications that improve our day-to-day business operations.
* Play a key role in major technology transitions, including our global ERP modernization and the enhancement of service delivery tools and processes.
* Develop and maintain Bromma’s IM architecture, ensuring a cohesive and functional strategy across our entire digital landscape.
* Work across a diverse technology stack with systems like SAP, Salesforce, Tacton CPQ, and Hybris eCommerce to solve technical and business challenges.


**What We Offer You**
*"Respect is how we work — across departments, across borders, across job titles. "*
* Rewards that truly count: We create opportunities for growth through diverse experiences and uphold fair, gender-neutral pay, fostering a culture built on equity, empowerment, and continuous development. We also offer a comprehensive rewards package which combines flexibility, wellness, and recognition.
* Safety that moves us forward: Build your career with a company rooted in safety since the 1940s, ensuring stability and an environment that empowers you to speak and be heard.
* Purpose that drives change: You'll contribute to solutions that transform global trade, creating environmental and operational innovations. You'll be in the driver's seat of ideas, developing digital technologies that set industry standards and position us as the forerunner.
* People who move together: You'll collaborate with people who build lasting relationships through global expertise, connections, and a commitment to sustainability.


 Become part of our global network of 5,300 professionals across 120+ countries, where your work drives innovation, sustainability, and meaningful impact around the world.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Role**
 We are looking for a pragmatic professional who enjoys the intersection of strategy and execution. To thrive in this role, you will have:
   

  

* Proven Digital Leadership: Significant experience driving digital transformation projects within large, international enterprise environments.
* Project Management Expertise: A solid track record of managing IT projects from start to finish, with the ability to navigate both Waterfall and Agile delivery methods.
* Technical Breadth: Broad expertise in enterprise applications and a deep understanding of how they integrate to support business goals.
* Hands-on Analytics Skills: Practical experience in analytics development, particularly within Google Cloud Platform (Data Studio, Connected Sheets) and the wider Google Workspace ecosystem.
* Architectural Mindset: Extensive experience in Information Management (IM) architecture and the ability to translate digitalization strategy into functional reality.
* Navigating Complexity: Experience working within complex IT ecosystems, ideally in an industrial or manufacturing setting, with an understanding of how digital tools support physical operations.
* Strong educational Foundation: B.Sc or M.Sc degree preferably in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Language Skills: Fluency in English is essential as it is our corporate language. Proficiency in Swedish is considered a strong asset.


**Ready to elevate your career? Apply today!**
 Join us and take the next step in your career journey with Bromma! As the interviews may begin before the closing date, we encourage early applications. Please submit your CV in English.
   

  

 We support hybrid work arrangements, offering flexibility to balance office and remote work but don’t provide relocation support.
   

  

 For more information on the role, please contact Joakim Heijbel, Director Digitalisation and Sustainability, via email: joakim.heijbel@bromma.com.
   

  

 Closing Date: 15/3/2026
   

  

 #Bromma
   

  

*Bromma is part of Kalmar.*
**About Kalmar**
*Kalmar (Nasdaq Helsinki: KALMAR) is moving goods in critical supply chains around the world, with the vision to be the forerunner in sustainable material handling equipment and services. The company offers a wide range of industry shaping heavy material handling equipment and services to ports and terminals, distribution centres, manufacturing and heavy logistics. Headquartered in Helsinki, Finland, Kalmar operates globally in over 120 countries and employs approximately 5,300 people. In 2025, the company's sales totalled approximately EUR 1.7 billion. www.kalmarglobal.com*

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
**Welcome!**
 Our Growth is Creating Great Opportunities!
   

  

 Our team is expanding, and we want to hire the most talented people we can. Continued success depends on it! Once you've had a chance to explore our current open positions, apply to the ones you feel suit you best and keep track of both your progress in the selection process, and new postings that might interest you!
   

  

 Thanks for your interest in working on our team!
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **highly motivated Solutions Engineer** 
 to join our team in Sweden. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in
 **Access Technologies including PON and Carrier Ethernet** 
 to support the Nordic Sales Team and drive technical excellence in customer engagements.
 **Optical Networking** 
 (WDM, Fiber Monitoring) experience is a strong advantage.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Act as the technical expert for mainly Access networking solutions, supporting sales initiatives and strategic accounts. Optical networking
* Communicate market trends, customer requirements, and feature requests to internal teams.
* Lead the technical aspects of major bids and tenders, collaborating closely with strategic customers, Product Line Management, and Business Development.
* Manage the RFX process and assist Key Account Managers with Win/Loss analysis, including documentation and tools.
* Provide direct technical support for major accounts and channel opportunities.
* Deliver customer demonstrations, trials, evaluations, and first installs in partnership with Customer Services.
* Offer technical consulting on network design, optimization, planning, and training for customers and the sales team.


**Knowledge, Skills And Experience Required**
* Good science / engineering degree or equivalent industry experience
* In-depth knowledge of Access network solutions. Transmission network knowledge is a strong advantage
* Experience with network providers, data centre, or telco / router equipment supplier area
* Fluent in English skills, both spoken and written – other languages are appreciated as well
* Robust personality and attitude essential
* Must have considerable presentation and meeting management experience


**Scope of employment**
* Fulltime / Permanent
* Office based (Stockholm), hybrid or remote working (Sweden).
* Readiness to travel in Nordics (35%)


**Primary location of job**
* Nordic region


**Compensation**
* Sales compensation scheme: Base salary + Commission

title: Facilities Manager, Data Center Operations
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
* 8 years of experience in the management of teams performing installation, maintenance, or upgrade work in data center or business-critical facilities.
* 7 years of experience in a Heating Ventilating and Air Conditioning (HVAC), electrical, controls, water chemistry, generators, mechanical, or other similar technical domain.
* 5 years of experience in data centers, hospitals, hotel industry, power plants, HV electrical substations, or other mission critical facility maintenance and operations.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Experience managing a large-scale, mission critical facilities portfolio or operations.
* Understanding of the operations and maintenance of electrical, control systems, and mechanical systems in a data center environment.
* Understanding of electrical and mechanical systems in data center environments and controls/monitoring systems.
* Ability to develop and grow team members, through coaching, mentoring, and training.
* Excellent people management and leadership skills, with the ability to influence at all levels.


**About the job** 
 The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and HVAC systems in the world. Facility Technicians at Google data centers operate, monitor and support physical facilities conditions. Some duties will include heating and cooling of air and water, power supply, generators, UPS systems, electrical distribution and control and monitoring systems. You regularly help inspect, maintain and repair various data center systems such as piping and non-critical electrical or mechanical system components). You'll provide daily assistance to senior technicians as you read blueprints/schematics, conduct tours of systems and assess their working order.
   

  

 You will develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving overall data center efficiency. You ensure that environmental and safety standards are consistently met, identifying problems and making repairs quickly In emergency situations or abnormal conditions, you manage data center performance issues and outages to minimize the recovery time from failures. Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Empower your team through hiring, talent development, and career support. Integrate Google-wide strategy with internal and external partners, ensuring aligned goals.
* Plan and manage operational budgets and expense forecasting. Create and deploy strategies for cost-effective operations focused on total cost of ownership.
* Meet service level agreements (SLAs) on uptime, efficiency, and cost with internal teams. Set strategy and plan deployments across multiple sites.
* Demonstrate critical thinking and innovation in addressing traditional and emergent data center issues. Demonstrate flexibility and the ability to support our operations, taking the lead in responding to critical events when necessary.
* Implement and drive a safety culture at the site. Lead by example, deliver results, develop people, and build community.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: HW Systems Engineer
description:
**Professional Galaxy** 
 is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise in IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.
   

  

 Are you the right person for the assignment, or do you want to recommend a strong candidate? Do not hesitate to contact us.
   

  

 Feel free to apply today, selection and interviews take place on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Professional Galaxy is looking for a
 **HW Systems Engineer** 
 on behalf of our client.
   

  

 Nivå 3 minst 3-7 års erfarenhet
   

  

 Nivå 4 minst 8-12 års erfarenhet
   

  

 In your role as HW Systems Engineer, you will have the opportunity to join the development of one of our EW systems to be delivered to an external customer, which is based on Client´s Arexis architecture. You will join a project that is in a very exciting phase, where the first prototypes are being produced, in order to validate the design concepts and provide feedback to the product versions that will enter into formal verification and qualification.
   

  

 You will be part of one of the teams developing one of the two sub-systems that constitute the EW system. Within this team you will perform systems engineering activities with special focus on HW integration and test of the main unit that controls the EW system, including but not limited to:
   

  

* Support with general systems engineering work (requirements update, test cases definition for formal verification and production testing, etc).
* Support HW prototype integration and test.
* Support HW troubleshooting.
* Gather the feedback from the testing to bring it back to the design and requirements.
* Support HW verification and qualification.
* Your profile: We are looking for someone who has a strong drive to bring things forward and that is a team player, able to communicate and coordinate with a large number of stakeholders. You are structured but flexible and able to adapt. You are a problem-solving oriented person.


 To thrive in this role, you have:
   

  

* A civil or university engineering degree in electronics, technical physics or related.
* Worked 10+ years as a systems engineer in the defense, train, radio-communications, med-tech industries or similar.
* Experience in general systems engineering processes, requirements management, etc.
* Experience in product development with special focus on HW development.
* Experience with HW integration and testing.
* You have previous knowledge or experience with RF and microwave.
* Good communication and social skills.
* Good knowledge of both Swedish and English.


**With us you will:**
* An inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome
* An employer where the focus is on a sustainable and safe society
* Flexibility in work, with a workplace that is both inspiring and important to the community
* Access to networks and role models in the industry
* Regular feedback and support to help you achieve your career goals.


 The position requires that you undergo and be approved according to the applicable security protection regulations. There may be a requirement for certain nationality.
   

  

 Work place: Järfälla to start with, but we will be moving our facilities to Solna.
   

  

**Other Information :**
**Assignment duration :** 
 2026-04-06 till Öppet
   

  

**Application Deadline** 
 : 2026-03-17
   

  

**Work Model :** 
 On-site
   

  

**Application Deadline :** 
 2026-03-16
   

  

 Please apply directly through our system with:
   

  

* Your updated CV
* Availability to start the assignment


 In the motivation, describe why you are suitable for this assignment - refer to previous consulting assignments, employment, education and personal qualities.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 We do not accept any applications through mail. All applications have to be sent through the portal to be valid.

title: Systemadministratör OpenShift
description:
Vill du jobba med teknik i framkant samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnytta? Vill du arbeta med att effektivisera och leverera Kubernetes/OpenShift åt Skatteverket och andra myndigheter? Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och bygga en säker, stabil och skalbar infrastruktur för både Skatteverket och andra myndigheter. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Skatteverkets it-avdelning är en av Sveriges största, med en stor och komplex it-miljö. Vi ansvarar för drift, förvaltning och utveckling av Skatteverkets och våra kunders it-system. Skatteverket har fått ett utökat uppdrag som innebär att vi ska tillhandahålla it-driftstjänster till fler myndigheter samt leverera en AI-verkstad för offentlig sektor. Vi utökar därför vårt team som ansvarar för OpenShift-plattformen. Tillsammans med kunniga och nytänkande kollegor kommer du att bidra till Skatteverkets uppdrag att skapa samhällsnytta.
   

  

 Du ingår i ett team som arbetar enligt GitOps som arbetssätt för att utveckla och förvalta kod. Du arbetar även med att bygga automationer för självbetjäning, monitorering och konfigurering i en multiklustermiljö. I arbetet använder du bland annat Helm-charts, GitHub, Argo CD och Vault. Teamet använder sig av innovationssprintar där ni tillsammans utvärderar nya produkter, verktyg och arbetssätt.
   

  

 I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår bland annat att arbeta med klustermanagering åt Skatteverket och övriga nyttjare av OpenShift-plattformen samt arbeta aktivt med säkerhetshöjande åtgärder. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår även deltagande i design och arkitektur för OpenShift-plattformen för Skatteverket och andra myndigheter.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Vi jobbar aktivt med kompetens-och teknikutveckling. Du har kunniga kollegor som du utbyter erfarenheter med och du kan utveckla både bredd och spets hos oss. Tack vare att vi är en stor it-organisation kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid och vi erbjuder bland annat flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Du får en friskvårdstimme i veckan och friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

 Du tillhör Operativsystemssektionen på enhet Skatteverkets tekniska tjänsteenhet (STT) på it-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och öppen för förändringar
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga, se mönster och kunna göra avgränsningar
* vara målfokuserad och bidra till att syftet med verksamheten uppnås
* ha förmågan att agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt
* ha förmågan att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom it alternativt flerårig, aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* flerårig, aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av OpenShift klustermanagering och förvaltning i enterprise-miljö.


 Det är önskvärt om du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med automation med stöd av Argo CD, GitHub, Ansible och/eller motsvarande som arbetsgivaren bedömer som relevant. Det är även önskvärt att du har relevant erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt med GitOps-arbetssätt.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/980 | Kontakt: Daniel Bynander (Rekryterande chef) daniel.bynander@skatteverket.se, Caroline Törnkvist (HR-specialist rekrytering) caroline.tornkvist@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Therese Sjödin, Seko therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se, Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2026-01-26 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2026-02-16

title: Consulting Associate Director- Cloud Transformation
description:
At
 **Gartner Consulting** 
 , we don't just advise; we equip leaders with
 **objective, data-driven insights** 
 from our unparalleled research and advisory business. As an Associate Director, you will lead complex cloud transformations, leveraging our proprietary frameworks and
 **unique access to enterprise data and analyst expertise** 
 to help clients make the right technology choices and achieve measurable business outcomes. You will leverage your understanding of cloud architectures and emerging technologies to shape transformation journeys, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and industry best practices.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Strategic Cloud Advisory: Partner with senior stakeholders to define cloud vision, strategy, and transformation roadmaps that support business growth, agility, and resilience.
* Cloud Value Realization: Identify opportunities for cost optimization, scalability, and competitive differentiation through effective cloud utilization and modernization.
* Transformation Leadership: Lead cloud readiness assessments, business case development, and executive workshops to build consensus and drive change across business and IT functions.
* Program Oversight: Manage cloud transformation initiatives, ensuring alignment with governance, security, compliance, and financial management standards.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Communicate complex cloud concepts in clear, business-focused language to facilitate decision-making and cross-functional collaboration.
* Continuous Improvement: Monitor cloud adoption metrics, provide actionable insights, and foster a culture of innovation and continuous learning.


**Required Experience & Skills:**
* Fluent in both Swedish & English
* Demonstrated experience in management consulting, digital transformation, or cloud strategy roles.
* Ability to translate business requirements into actionable cloud strategies and solutions, leveraging knowledge of service and deployment models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS; public, private, hybrid).
* Familiarity with major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their strategic capabilities, as well as the current trends and best practices.
* Understanding of cloud governance, security, compliance, and risk management principles.
* Experience leading cloud projects using Agile methodologies, ensuring timely delivery and adaptability to evolving client needs.
* Exceptional communication skills, with a track record of engaging and influencing senior stakeholders.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience with cloud reference architectures, cloud landing zones, and modern application delivery models (containerization, serverless, microservices).
* Knowledge of data integration and migration strategies to support seamless transformation.
* Relevant cloud certifications are advantageous but not mandatory.


**Why Join Us?**
* Work with the World's Best Data: Gain unmatched access to Gartner's proprietary research, data, and a network of 2,000+ industry analysts. You'll deliver advice that is objective, actionable, and backed by the most comprehensive IT data in the world and in collaboration with a team of forward-thinking consultants in a dynamic, growth-oriented environment.
* Focus on the Right Advice, Not the Next Project: Unlike traditional consulting, our model prioritizes client success over project duration. Your goal is to provide unbiased, impactful advice, not to prolong engagements.
* Unrivalled Professional Development: Our internal knowledge sharing, direct access to analysts, and dedicated training programs ensure you're always at the forefront of cloud trends.


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective business and technology insights, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our vast, virtually untapped market potential offers limitless opportunities – opportunities that may not even exist right now – for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:100847
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Backend Engineer, Core Experience
description:
**Experience Mission**
 The Experience Mission designs Spotify’s consumer experience—end to end, moment to moment, across every screen, platform, and partner integration. Our mission is to make listening feel effortless, personal, and joyful for billions of users around the world. That means turning complexity into clarity across hundreds of touch points —from our mobile and desktop apps to the smart speakers, TVs, cars, and integrations where Spotify shows up every day. If it touches a consumer, we shape it. We bring deep insight into human behavior, design, and technology to craft experiences that feel intuitive, expressive, and unmistakably Spotify.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Meadow sits within the CoreX studio and builds the backend services powering entity pages in the Spotify mobile app—such as artist, album, playlist, and other foundational surfaces.
   

  

 You’ll join a collaborative team of backend and client engineers working closely with partners across Studios to shape and scale the future of Spotify’s listening experience for millions of users worldwide.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Design, build, and operate backend services that are reliable, low-latency, and ready to scale globally.
* Partner with engineers and product teams across Spotify to design APIs and data flows that power user-facing experiences.
* Take ownership of your services end-to-end, including operations and on-call participation.
* Evolve our architecture to support new features, performance improvements, and long-term technical health.
