title: Join Our Team as Services Sales Director in Sweden!
description:
Step into a role where you shape sales strategy and bring service offerings to customers.
  
As our Services Sales Director in Sweden, you will lead a talented team of Services Sales Representatives. Your mission will be to develop a high-performance team while managing some key accounts and opportunities yourself.
  
What drives us at Schneider Electric?
  
For us, impact isn’t just a term paraded across posters or social media; it’s encoded into our culture. After all, Schneider makes companies, infrastructure, buildings, homes, data centers, and entire industries more efficient and sustainable. With us, you’ll contribute to tackling the climate crisis head-on, and accelerating the energy transition the planet urgently needs. There’s a reason why we’re consistently ranked among the most sustainable companies in the world. Here, you can pursue your dream career while actively making a long-term, positive impact on the planet. With us, you’ll contribute to tackling the climate crisis head-on, and accelerating the energy transition the planet urgently needs. What’s more, we help tens of millions of people in underserved communities gain access to energy and education — so you’re making the world a fairer place, too. You’ll sit among colleagues with vastly different personal and professional backgrounds, all united by a vision of a better world.
  
What you’ll do
  
Lead the team of Services Sales Representatives & act as a people manager according to our values & leadership code
  
Drive sales excellence across account management and pipeline management
  
Build the growth strategic plan, including both vision and sales execution roadmap for Services in Sweden
  
Convert services leads from the Installed base into business opportunities
  
Drive transformation towards a digital, consultative business approach.
  
Collaborate closely with other sales, tendering, business support and operations teams in Sweden and the Nordic Zone
  
Articulate the consistency of all Service offers all along the life cycles stages, positioning as a top priority our recurring revenue through service contracts
  
Contribute to Country Plan for Global Accounts and Targeted Accounts
  
Manage Service offer pricing based on margin expectations.
  
  

Essential for the Role
  
Commercial mindset with strong drive and interest in technology; able to learn new technologies quickly at a general level
  
Prior success in achieving sales targets and developing long-term customer partnerships
  
Solid experience from Energy or IT industry, especially in customer-facing roles and within sales
  
Ability to build lasting customer relationships at all levels (partners, end users, C-level)
  
Basic technical understanding from segments such as Cloud & Service Provider, Power & Grid as well as overall knowledge of software, digital transformation, and solution services.
  
Experience from Medium Voltage, Low Voltage, UPS, Cooling or Industrial Automation is beneficial
  
Strong written, verbal, and visual communication skills
  
**Language skills:** fluent English
  
Able to work effectively with internal and external stakeholders and build relationships across business units and lead teams to success
  
  

Why Schneider Electric?
  
**Flexibility:** With our Global Flexibility at Work policy, and our hybrid work model, we empower our employees for their work-life integration.
  
**Career Development:** We provide a rich environment for our people to grow and learn every day through our career development model.
  
**Good Benefits:** Schneider Electric offers a robust benefits package to support our employees such as paid family leave, a culture of wellness and much more.
  
**Inclusive Environment:** We build a culture of respect where everyone feels safe to be their authentic selves. We are fully committed to inclusion, and our policies and culture reflect this commitment
  
So, what’s Next?
  
If you’re ready to take on a high-impact role in a dynamic environment, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and help us shape the future of industrial project management.
  
Where can I find out more?
  
**About Schneider Electric:** https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VbldHPFltQQ

title: Digital redaktör / Art Director
description:
**Digital redaktör / Art Director** 

Vill du arbeta brett med digitalt innehåll, design och sociala medier – och samtidigt vara med och bygga ett livsstilsvarumärke i tillväxt? Livsstil24.se söker en digital redaktör / art director som tar ett helhetsansvar för sajten, våra nyheter, annonser och visuella uttryck.

Det här är en roll för dig som är både redaktionell och visuell, som gillar ansvar och som trivs när tempo, kreativitet och struktur går hand i hand.

**Om rollen**  
I rollen ansvarar du för Livsstil24.se:s löpande innehåll, inklusive nyheter, publicering, layout och annonsering. Du arbetar operativt i WordPress och säkerställer att sajten är uppdaterad, visuellt stark och redaktionellt relevant.

Rollen innefattar även redaktörs- och layoutansvar för en tematidning som distribueras tillsammans med Svenska Dagbladet 2–3 gånger i månaden. Där ansvarar du för både innehåll och form, från planering till färdig produktion.

Utöver detta har du ansvar för Livsstil24:s närvaro i sociala medier och arbetar strategiskt och operativt med Instagram, LinkedIn och TikTok för att bygga räckvidd, engagemang och varumärke.

**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:**

* Redaktionellt och visuellt ansvar för Livsstil24.se
* Publicering, layout och hantering av annonser på sajten
* Arbete i WordPress (CMS, innehåll, struktur och layout)
* Redaktörs- och layoutansvar för tematidning i samarbete med Svenska Dagbladet
* Planering, skapande och publicering av innehåll i sociala medier
* Säkerställa en enhetlig tonalitet och visuellt uttryck i alla kanaler

**Vi söker dig som:**

* Har mycket goda kunskaper i WordPress (krav)
* Har erfarenhet av digital redaktionell produktion
* Har ett starkt designöga och vana av layoutarbete
* Har erfarenhet av Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator)
* Har god språkkänsla och erfarenhet av redigering och rubriksättning
* Har arbetat med sociala medier, gärna Instagram, LinkedIn och TikTok
* Är självgående, strukturerad och trygg i att ta eget ansvar

**Vi erbjuder:**

* En bred och kreativ heltidstjänst med stort ansvar
* Möjlighet att arbeta både digitalt och med tryckt tematidning
* En plattform i utveckling där du får sätta din egen prägel
* Ett högt tempo och varierade arbetsuppgifter

**Ansökan**  
Vi intervjuar löpande och tillsätter tjänsten så snart rätt person hittas.

Välkommen till Livsstil24 – här får du arbeta med innehåll, form och distribution i ett sammanhang där allt hänger ihop.

title: Technical Services Engineer, German-speaking (fluent level)
description:
Job Title
Technical Services Engineer, German-speaking (fluent level)
Job Description
Axis now has a job opening for a permanent role in the Technical Services team, and we are eager to find a German- (fluent level) and English-speaking Technical Services Engineer.
Take a look at your future team behind the scenes by clicking/pasting this link:
https://youtu.be/7IhTip6pfMA
At your disposal, you will have senior Technical Services Engineers, a team of Product Specialists and all your other Technical Services colleagues that are able to provide product-specific assistance and general help in the role. You will be a part of a diverse team of around 50 people.
This position is located in Lund, the southern part of Sweden, in close proximity to both Malmö and Copenhagen.
We offer great benefits, like breakfast every day, classic “Swedish Fika” on Fridays, physical training grants, insurance and an extensive onboarding program.
What you will do as a Technical Services Engineer:* Provide profound technical support to our partners and customers in the German-speaking market.
* Communicate with customers through a web-based ticketing system, telephone support and chat system.
* Continuously grow your knowledge within the ever-expanding Axis product portfolio.

*You have a lab with our product portfolio and supportive colleagues that allows you to dig deeper into complex scenarios and solutions in the back end.*
Your primary responsibilities will be:* Provide "first-call-resolution" wherever possible and have ownership of customer inquiries through fulfilment.
* Assist with product system navigation, first-time installation guidance etc.
* Ask customers targeted questions to understand the root cause of the problem quickly.
* Concisely and effectively answer customer service inquiries.
* Diagnose and troubleshoot problems related to both software and hardware.


Who are we looking for?
Working as a Technical Services Engineer requires good communication and problem-solving skills. We believe that being energetic and self-sufficient is important to be successful in this role. Understanding professional communication, adapting to the customer needs, and following up with customers are important requirements.
Since you, as a Technical Services Engineer, will be supporting the German-speaking market, *you must be able to* *both**speak and write German on a fluent level,* *and you also need* *fluent English* *for this position.*
We would love to hear that you have/are:* An IT education/courses and experience from the IT-industry.
* Experience from customer support where you have had time to develop excellent communication skills.
* The ability to address technical issues with warmth and empathy – not only in verbal communication but also in written form.
* A good technical foundation to stand on, including network concepts and Microsoft Windows OS (bonus points for Linux-knowledge).
* Previous experience with technical troubleshooting.
* Bonus points for previous experience with Salesforce (Service Cloud).


As a member of the Axis team, you will be part of a young, dynamic and multicultural environment. You would be working with highly developed technology and a high-valued brand. Together with your colleagues, you will be considered a key asset in moving Axis towards the goal of being number one in their industry and giving our customers a state-of-the-art service.
Ready to act?
Openness might be a buzz word in other companies, but at Axis, this is the core of who we are. Our most important asset is our ability to cooperate. We have realized that great ideas can come from anywhere. Therefore, we encourage everybody to contribute and innovate.
Do you recognize yourself in this profile? Then we want to hear from you!
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2026-03-10*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast

title: Lead Architect
description:
#### **About the Role**


We are looking for a **Lead Architect** to define and drive the technical vision for our entire technology stack. As the senior authority on architecture, you will set principles, patterns, and standards that guide our engineering teams while enabling them to deliver efficiently and reliably.


This role partners closely with the Head of Platform Engineering to ensure that architectural decisions are operationally feasible, scalable, and aligned with business needs. You will also collaborate with software Architects to implement best practices, frameworks, and patterns across our systems.

#### **What You’ll Do**

**Architectural Vision**

* Define and maintain the end-to-end target architecture across all systems and domains: backend, frontend, data, QA, and infrastructure.
* Establish architecture principles, patterns, and standards that guide development across all teams.
* Maintain architectural artifacts, including system diagrams, architectural decision records, and reference architectures.

**Cross-Team Alignment**

* Collaborate with Software Architects to ensure technical coherence across all domains.
* Review and challenge major design proposals to ensure consistent, high-quality technical decisions.
* Partner with Engineering Managers to ensure architecture is applied consistently across product teams.

**Technical Leadership & Mentorship**

* Serve as a trusted advisor to Software Architects, Engineering Managers, and senior engineers.
* Mentor teams on design patterns, best practices, and long-term maintainability.
* Evaluate emerging technologies and frameworks, recommending adoption or deprecation as appropriate.

**Governance & Communication**

* Lead or advise on technical forums, architecture boards, and design reviews.
* Ensure architectural decisions balance innovation, scalability, and operational constraints.
* Advocate for technical excellence while empowering teams to execute independently.

#### **What Success Looks Like**

* Architecture is consistent and adhered to across teams.
* Systems are maintainable, scalable, and of high quality.
* Software Architects’ practices are adopted effectively across engineering.
* Architectural decisions are implemented with minimal operational rework.
* Architecture aligns with platform, cloud, and developer experience capabilities.

#### **Who You Are**

* Deep experience across full-stack systems, including backend (.NET), frontend (React), cloud (Azure), Data (MS Fabric) and 3rd party integrations.
* Strong technical judgment with clear opinions on target architecture and best practices.
* Skilled at influencing multiple teams and senior technical leaders without direct authority.
* Experienced in mentoring, designing, and reviewing complex systems.
* Familiar with modern software architecture patterns: microservices, Clean Architecture, domain-driven design, and cloud-first practices.

#### **Who You’ll Work With**

* **Software Architects (Backend/Frontend/QA/Data):** Guide domain-level technical decisions.
* **Engineering Managers & Product Managers:** Provide architectural guidance and review cross-team designs.
* **Head of Platform Engineering:** Ensure operational feasibility and platform alignment.
* **CTO:** Partner on strategic technology direction.

title: Data Center Technician Trainee, Data Center Operations, Data Center Operations
description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


Amazon Web Services (AWS) is growing rapidly, and we are looking for a Trainee Data Center Technician to join our Rack Decommissioning team as part of our Work Based Learning Program (WBLP).  

As a trainee, you will participate in our 3 months work and training program. This position will help ensure overall availability and reliability for our customers within our Data Centers in Sweden.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Installing new rack equipment
* Decommissioning existing racks
* Repairing and diagnosing broken servers
* Handling computer equipment and parts
* Managing network hear during installation, decommissioning, and repair

  

A day in the life  

In this role, you'll be working on our advanced ticketing system  

  

You'll be part of a collaborative team that keeps our cloud infrastructure running smoothly, responding to both automated directives and team leadership with exceptional time management and adaptability.  

  

Your expertise in problem ticket tracking and escalation procedures will be crucial as you consistently meet and exceed Amazon's high standards for technical proficiency and operational excellence. This role is vital in maintaining the efficiency and reliability of our sophisticated data center infrastructure – you'll be working and supporting the face of Cloud technology in the region.  

  

About the team  

Diverse Experiences  

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  

  

Why AWS?  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  

  

Inclusive Team Culture  

Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.  

  

Mentorship & Career Growth  

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.  

  

Work/Life Balance  

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* High school or equivalent diploma
* STEM classes or vocational course curriculum education
* Are 18 years of age or older
* Work 40 hours/week

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* This position also has a physical component requiring the ability to lift & rack equipment up to 20Kg; it may require working in cramped spaces or in elevated locations while adhering to health & safety guidelines.
* Familiarity with computer hardware components and operating systems
* Ability to manage work and priorities through a ticketing system and coordination with Manager
* Has taken STEM or vocational course curriculum

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Work Schedule**


Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Office**Job Description**


As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

**Location/Division Specific Information:**


At the Proteomics Sciences division, former Olink Proteomics, we are transforming the understanding of human diseases through advanced protein biomarker discovery. With our innovative Olink solutions – including highly specific and validated assays that cover more than 5,000 proteins – our colleagues and technology empower scientists in groundbreaking research that will play a pivotal role in the future of personalized medicine.

 **Job Specific Information:**


We are currently seeking a Data Scientist for our Data Science Development team at Olink. Our Data Scientists are responsible for developing custom analysis tools and methods to enable data driven innovation and decisions. The team is involved in both product and process development and is responsible for data related product design decisions, data analysis and reporting, method and tool development etc. Their goal is to ensure good study design, appropriate analytical methods and data driven decisions in all steps leading to high quality products and processes.

 **Main Responsibilities:**

* Develop methods and tools for data analysis for external and internal use using predefined guidelines or procedures.
* Engage in the creation of modern bioinformatic and data analytics solutions.
* Development of methods to support our products throughout the product life cycle using predefined guidelines or procedures.
* Assist in quality control and troubleshooting of data issues.
* Monitoring and analysis of QC parameters to ensure quality in products and processes.
* Create clear and actionable data visualizations and reports for technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Collaborate with other data scientists, data engineers, and domain experts in cross-functional project teams
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of data pipelines, analytical tools, and best practices

 **Qualifications**

* MSc in Bioinformatics, Biostatistics, Computer Science, Molecular Biology or similar
* 1+ year of relevant industry experience building production-quality code, applications, or pipelines
* Solid programming skills in languages such as R or Python
* Experience in applying statistical methods in medical or biological research, especially with data from high throughput technologies in proteomics and genomics
* Analytical mind and an interest in modern statistical and data analysis methods including machine learning
* Full professional proficiency in English
* Experience in R package development, Git and shiny development is an advantage
* Experience with cloud platforms (e.g. AWS) is an advantage
* Experience from data engineering and/or building modern data analysis environments is an advantage
* Ability to work across different teams and subject areas
* Demonstrated strong communication skills, both oral and written

 **Why Join Us?**


At Olink, Thermo Fisher Scientific, you will be part of a nurturing team that values integrity, innovation, and involvement. We offer an encouraging environment where your diverse experiences and perspectives are appreciated, enabling you to thrive and excel in your career. Come aboard and contribute significantly to global health and safety!  

  

If you believe you’re the right fit for this role, we encourage you to submit your resume along with a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience.
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: AI Engineer till Avanzas AI-plattformsteam
description:
*Vill du vara med och bygga fundamentet för hur AI används i hjärtat av Sveriges ledande plattform för sparande och investeringar? Vi startar nu ett dedikerat AI-plattformsteam med uppdraget att göra Avanza ”AI-first” genom att bygga verktyg och infrastruktur för framtidens kundupplevelse och nutidens utvecklarupplevelse.*

*Vi söker passionerade AI-utvecklare som vill vara med från start och bygga ett team som möjliggör för hela Avanza att skapa värde med AI på ett säkert, skalbart och innovativt sätt.*

### **Om rollen**


Som en del av AI-plattformsteamet har du ett brett och spännande mandat. Din mission är dubbel: du ska både skapa en utvecklarupplevelse i världsklass genom AI-driven utveckling (DevEx), och bygga en robust AI-plattform i Google Cloud som bär våra framtida kundfunktioner. Du kommer att arbeta nära våra utvecklingsteam för att utforska, testa och sätta standarder för AI-engineering på Avanza.

**Du kommer bland annat att:**

* Driva AI-driven DevEx: Skapa en utvecklarmiljö som möjliggör AI-first utveckling i våra produkt- och plattformsteam. Utforska och utveckla ekosystem runt AI-driven utveckling samt Gemini Enterprise för att göra våra kollegor mer effektiva.
* Bygga agenter och automatiseringar: Utveckla och drifta MCP-servrar, agenter och andra system som automatiserar interna arbetsflöden.
* Utveckla AI-plattformen: Sätta upp den tekniska grunden i GCP och Vertex AI för AI-baserade features i våra produkter.
* Enablement & Coaching: Arbeta nära våra produkt- och plattformsteam och övriga Avanza för att stötta dem i AI-resan.
* Säkerställa kontroll: Samarbeta kring riskbedömningar i vårt AI-råd och tillsammans med säkerhetsteam implementera guardrails och säkerhetslösningar som skyddar både vår data och våra kunder.

### **Din profil:**


Vi söker dig som inte bara följer utvecklingen inom AI, utan som redan har börjat bygga, experimentera och använda AI som en naturlig del av ditt arbete. Du trivs i en miljö där ”best practice” ännu inte är skriven och motiveras av att skapa konkret värde här och nu, snarare än att fastna i eviga utvärderingar och piloter.


Då teamet är ett plattformsteam är du prestigelös och får en kick av att hjälpa dina kollegor att lyckas, samtidigt som du har förmågan att stänga in dig och fokusera djupt på komplexa ännu olösta problem.

**Vidare tror vi att du har:**

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av professionell mjukvaruutveckling och en stark arkitektonisk förståelse från fler än en tidigare arbetsplats.
* Erfarenhet av AI-engineering. Du har arbetat praktiskt med LLM-integrationer, prompt engineering och bygga agenter.
* God förståelse för modern, AI-driven spec-driven kodning.
* Erfarenhet av molnmiljöer (vi kör GCP/Vertex AI).
* Kunskap om, eller ett stort intresse för, kontext-engineering, MCP-servrar, och allt relaterat.
* Förmågan att kommunicera komplex teknik på ett pedagogiskt sätt till kollegor i hela organisationen.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.

**Meriterande:**

* Expertis inom GCP (Terraform, IAM, projektstruktur)
* Erfarenhet av säkerhet och riskbedömning kopplat till AI och data.
* Bakgrund från reglerade miljöer (finans/bank).
* Programmering i Python eller annat scriptspråk
* Hos oss får du chansen att vara med i det mest spännande teknikskiftet i vår tid, i ett team där din påverkan på Avanzas framtid blir direkt och mätbar. Vi lovar högt tempo, stor frihet och ett gäng fantastiska kollegor.

### **Ansökan**


Skicka in din ansökan via "Ansök nu"-knappen i annonsen. Urval sker löpande, så vänta inte – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!


Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta Mats Oldin, Head of AI Engineering, på mats.oldin@avanza.se.

*Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt kontakt från rekryteringsföretag och annonssäljare.*

title: Researcher Scalable Systems
description:
*AI is developing fast – far beyond the speed of traditional technological evolution. Do you, just like us, want to help shape the future of distributed digital infrastructure and next‑generation AI systems?*


We are looking for a researcher with strong expertise in distributed systems, digital infrastructure and AI‑oriented computing. And someone who is motived by complex technological challenges and by advancing the next generation of scalable AI systems.

**About us**


At RISE, the unit *Scalable Systems* conducts applied research and development in the field of distributed digital infrastructure. From advanced datacentres to 5G edge nodes and high‑performance networks, we work at the forefront of next‑generation AI‑driven systems.


Our team is interdisciplinary and hands‑on, we are a mix of researchers and R&D engineers developing practical, scalable solutions together with industry partners, public agencies, and academia.


We operate several advanced testbeds for datacentre and 5G edge computing, which serve as national innovation platforms for developing and validating distributed AI and edge‑based applications in realistic environments.

**About the role**


In this position, you will take a central role in shaping research and technological development within distributed AI infrastructure. You will:

* Lead and contribute to research and innovation projects
* Develop methods for orchestrating AI workloads across cloud, datacentre, edge and device.
* Evaluate new technologies and architectures within your area
* Define technical roadmaps guiding the future of RISE’s infrastructure and its' related solutions
* Use and further develop RISE’s datacentre and 5G‑edge testbeds as research platforms
* Collaborate with engineers responsible for implementation and operations
* Represent RISE in research collaborations, technical forums and strategic partnerships


The role is primarily based in Luleå or Kista, Stockholm, with hybrid work possible. Regular presence in Luleå is required given the close connection to our datacentre and infrastructure environments.


Because some projects may be security‑sensitive, a security clearance may be required now or in the future

**Who are you?**


Required qualifications

* PhD in computer science, computer engineering or a closely related field
* Experience in research or advanced development within distributed systems, AI infrastructure or datacentre‑related technologies
* Experience contributing to research or innovation projects
* Strong understanding of distributed systems and digital infrastructure
* Experience with Linux‑based systems
* Experience working with containerised environments and orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes)
* Understanding of modern AI infrastructure and its requirements
* Excellent communication skills in English


Meriting qualifications

* Hands‑on experience with edge computing or distributed infrastructure
* Experience with AI workloads, including training and inference
* Experience with datacentre technologies or GPU‑based systems
* Familiarity with high‑performance networking (e.g. RDMA, InfiniBand)
* Experience with distributed storage systems
* Previous participation in national or EU research proposals
* Ability to define technical roadmaps
* Experience in interdisciplinary collaboration
* Good communiation skills in Swedish


Personal qualities

* A strong technical interest and a desire to work at the forefront of technology
* Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
* Strong analytical skills
* Communicative and able to collaborate with both technical and non‑technical stakeholders
* A strategic mindset and the ability to see the bigger picture in complex systems
* Be proactive and contribute to the development of new research areas

**Are we a good match?**


We work across the entire AI pipeline – from data collection and communication to distributed computation, model training and inference – with a focus on scalability, resilience and technological sovereignty.


RISE also operates advanced testbeds for 5G and edge computing, enabling research on distributed AI systems in realistic environments where datacentres, edge nodes and connected devices interact. This provides a unique opportunity to work with real infrastructure and experiment with next‑generation distributed AI systems.


As a researcher at RISE, you will have:

* The opportunity to work with advanced datacentre and edge infrastructure
* The chance to influence the development of future AI infrastructure
* Collaboration with leading industrial and research partners
* A combination of applied research and technical development
* The possibility to contribute to societally important and strategic technologies
* A flexible and research‑driven work environment

**Welcome with your application!**


If you are interested and want to know more you are welcome to contact us: Martin Simonsson, Director Scalable Systems, **martin.simonsson@ri.se**. The application deadline is **March 8th**. Selection and interviews may take place continuously during and after the application period. Apply without cover letter.


Our union representatives are Ingemar Petermann, SACO, +46 10 228 41 22 and Linda Ikatti, Unionen, +46 10 516 51 61.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
*Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens IT-infrastruktur i en modern och tekniskt avancerad miljö? Vi söker nu flera duktiga Infrastructure Engineers som vill arbeta med cloud, automation och storskaliga system i ett engagerat team där innovation, samarbete och ständig utveckling står i fokus.*

### **Om tjänsten**


I tjänsten som Infrastructure Engineer kommer du arbeta tillsammans med ett team i en modern IT-miljö. Du kommer att arbeta med att administrera och automatisera storskaliga system och vi söker efter dig som har arbetat med cloud, virtualisering och moderna lagringstekniker.


Som Infrastructure Engineer är det en självklarhet att definiera infrastruktur som kod för att underlätta din och andras vardag. Vi ser att du, precis som vi, vill lära dig om, och jobba mer med containers och cloud samtidigt som det behöver fungera med en on-prem lösning. Vi arbetar även med Windows operativ i en virtuell GCP miljö.

**Du kommer även att arbeta med:**

* Definiera och hantera infrastruktur som kod
* Hantera virtualiseringslösningar som Openshift Virtualization, HyperV
* Arbeta med moderna lagringstekniker


Du kommer att ingå i vårt Infrastructure-team på 8 personer som tillsammans ser till att vi alltid levererar stabila och säkra tjänster till våra kunder. Du kommer få möjlighet att utvecklas i ett engagerat team som ger dig mycket förtroende och som team ansvarar man för att tillhandahålla våra bas-infrastrukturtjänster och även att ständigt framtidssäkra vår IT-miljö.

### **Vem vi söker**


För att vara framgångsrik i rollen som Infrastructure Engineer hos oss bör du vara en nyfiken problemlösare med en passion för teknik och drivkraft att ständigt förbättra. Ditt engagemang att vilja lära dig mer om och hålla dig uppdaterad kring de senaste teknikerna är viktigt för att du ska ta dig an nya utmaningar. Vidare söker vi dig med en analytisk förmåga som kommer att vara avgörande i rollen för att effektivt optimera våra system och identifiera komplexa tekniska utmaningar som kan uppstå.


Observera att vi söker flera Infrastructure Engineers med olika kompetensområden om du känner att du inte täcker in allt i beskrivningen.

**Vi ser gärna att du har:**

* Goda kunskaper inom datacenterinfrastruktur och av plattformar som Openshift eller Kubernetes eller HyperV
* God erfarenhet av Linuxsystemadministration (RHEL) i stor skala
* God erfarenhet av Windowsadministration inklusive applikationsdrift
* Goda kunskaper inom Cloud (GCP, Azure)
* Kunskap i IaC-verktyg som Puppet, Ansible, Terraform
* Färdigheter inom moderna lagringstekniker som Dell Powerstore


Du ska trivas i en dynamisk miljö där förändring och innovation är en del av vardagen. Du har förmågan att snabbt anpassa dig till nya situationer och möjligheter som uppstår. Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats med mycket frihet att få pröva dina kunskaper på egen hand, men som även ser samarbetet med teamet som en värdefull del av ditt arbete.


Vi tror på kraften i samarbete och kunskapsutbyte med kollegor för att tillsammans skapa framgångsrika projekt. Vi hoppas att du delar denna syn och vill bli en del av vårt Infrastructure-team.

### **Ansökan**


Skicka din ansökan genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök nu” under annonsen. Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast då urvalet sker löpande. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail p.g.a. GDPR. Kontakta gärna Marie Grenander, Engineering Manager, på marie.grenander@avanza.se om du har några frågor om tjänsten.


Välkommen med din ansökan!

*Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.*

title: Animator
description:
*What if you could create lifelike digital humans — not for a cinematic, but for a continuously running real-time multiplayer platform?*

*At Avanti, we combine advanced game technology with cloud infrastructure to build a new generation of interactive gaming experiences. Instead of traditional live studios, we create scalable digital environments powered by motion capture, AI-driven characters and real-time systems.*

*Now we are looking for an* ***Animator*** *who wants to push realism inside a real-time engine environment.*

**The Role – Creating Lifelike Digital Humans**
-----------------------------------------------


You will work with motion capture data, refine it, shape it and implement it inside Unreal Engine to ensure seamless, believable animation flows.


Your focus will include:

* Clean and process motion capture data from live dealer performances
* Translate live capture data into Metahuman character rigs
* Refine and enhance mocap animations to ensure natural, fluid movement on Metahumans
* Create transitional animations and blends between mocap sequences
* Develop animation libraries for various dealer actions (card dealing, chip handling, gestures)
* Work with Metahuman facial capture and animation systems
* Collaborate with developers to implement animations in Unreal Engine
* Optimize animations for real-time streaming performance
* Maintain consistency and quality across all dealer animations


The challenge is subtle but demanding: Characters must feel human, in their movement in the way they act. Not static and robotic, which is going to be fun!


Transitions must be seamless. Sequences must blend naturally. Movements must respond correctly to gameplay logic.

**Functional Skills**
---------------------


We are specifically looking for:

* Proven experience working with **motion capture pipelines**
* Strong animation skills in **Maya**
* Experience implementing animation inside **Unreal Engine**
* Deep understanding of **animation blending and state machines**
* Strong understanding of human movement and body mechanics
* Ability to work in a real-time production environment


We are looking for someone who understands the full animation lifecycle — from capture to final in-engine implementation.

**Nice to Have**
----------------

* Experience working with Metahuman
* Background in AAA, gaming or real-time interactive productions
* Experience optimizing animation for performance in engine

**Who You Are**
---------------

* You care deeply about realism.
* You notice when something feels off — even if others don’t.
* You enjoy refining details until movement feels natural.
* You understand both the artistic and technical side of animation.
* You are collaborative, communicative and comfortable working closely with developers and technical artists.


You are curious about new technology and want to be part of building something new — not just contributing to a predefined pipeline.

**Why Avanti?**
---------------


We operate at the intersection of game development and regulated iGaming. Few companies globally combine motion capture, real-time engines and cloud infrastructure at this level.


We are stable and growing rapidly.  

We are building technology that replaces traditional studio setups with scalable digital systems.  

We work with major operators and expand into new markets.


You will join at a stage where:

* Systems are evolving
* Realism is a competitive advantage
* Your work directly impacts the product experience


You get:

* Stock option program in the future
* Wellness allowance & gym membership
* Hybrid setup
* An English-speaking, technically ambitious team


This is an opportunity to work on lifelike digital humans in a real-time environment that operates at scale.

**The Team**
------------


You will join the Live Experience Team (8 people). You will collaborate closely with Gameplay Developers and Technical Artists to ensure animation integrates seamlessly into the engine.

**The Process**
---------------

* Initial conversation
* Portfolio & technical deep dive
* Final discussion with the Hiring Manager


If you are an Animator with strong motion capture experience and a passion for real-time realism — we would love to connect.


Let’s redefine what digital humans can look like in live interactive environments.

title: 3D-Generalist / 3D Artist
description:
*What if your 3D assets weren’t just beautiful — but part of a real-time, cloud-streamed multiplayer system used at scale?*

*At Avanti, we combine* ***Unreal Engine 5, motion capture, AI-driven digital humans and Google Cloud infrastructure*** *to build a new generation of interactive multiplayer games.*

*We don’t operate traditional live studios.*  

*We build digital, scalable worlds powered by game technology.*

*Now we are looking for a* ***3D-Generalist*** *who wants to be at the intersection of modeling, lighting and real-time implementation.*

**The Role – Where Art Meets Real-Time Systems**
------------------------------------------------


You will act as the bridge between modeling, animation and implementation — ensuring that assets don’t just look good in isolation, but function flawlessly inside Unreal Engine.


You will work with:

* Create high-quality 3D models for casino props (cards, chips, tables, equipment)
* Develop dealer accessories, clothing, and character-related assets for Metahuman characters
* Produce both high-poly models and optimized real-time versions
* Create PBR materials and textures that look stunning in Unreal Engine
* Collaborate with environment artists and animators to ensure asset integration
* Ensure assets work seamlessly with Metahuman characters and live capture system
* Optimize models for streaming performance without sacrificing visual quality
* Maintain consistency in style and quality across all assets
* Assist with various 3D tasks as project needs evolve


Your work will directly impact realism.  

And realism is core to what we build.


You are part artist, part problem solver, part real-time builder. From character elements to environments and props, your responsibility is to make sure everything holds together — visually and technically.


This is a high-delivery environment where realism matters. The challenge is demanding — and that’s exactly what makes it exciting.

**The Techstack**
-----------------


You will work with:

* Unreal Engine 5
* Maya
* Metahuman
* Real-time rendering pipelines
* Lighting in Unreal
* Motion capture-driven characters


Experience with Blender or Marvelous Designer is a plus, but not required.


AAA background is welcome, but what matters most is your ability to work in real-time pipelines and ship production-ready assets.

**Who You Are**
---------------


You likely:

* Have strong experience in Maya and Unreal Engine
* Understand real-time asset workflows
* Care deeply about lighting and realism
* Enjoy solving problems across disciplines
* Take ownership and improve what you see


You are curious about new technology.  

You want to build something that hasn’t been done before.

**Why Avanti?**
---------------


We operate at the intersection of game development and regulated iGaming. Few companies globally are combining Unreal Engine, motion capture, AI-generated characters and cloud streaming at this level.


We are a stable company and are currently scaling our company with plans to expand the coming years! The systems you work on today will define how we scale tomorrow.


We build for real customers like LeoVegas and Svenska Spel. Our platform runs on Google Cloud and is designed for continuous deployment, not static production cycles.


You get:

* Stock option program in the future!
* Wellness allowance & gym membership
* Hybrid setup (office-first mindset)
* An English-speaking, technically driven team


This is startup energy — backed by capital and real growth.

**The Team**
------------


You will join the Live Experience Team (8 people) and work closely with Animators and Technical Artists in a collaborative, technically ambitious environment.

**The Process**
---------------

* Initial conversation
* Portfolio & technical deep dive
* Final discussion with the Hiring Manager


If you are a 3D-Generalist who wants to work with Unreal Engine 5, Metahuman and real-time cloud-powered systems — we would love to connect.


Let’s build the next generation of real-time interactive experiences.

title: Solution Engineering Internship Opportunities
description:
**Overview**
**Start date: September 2026 (for 10 months)**
**Type of Employment: Full - Time Internship**
**Location: Stockhlom, Sweden**
**Application must be submitted in English**
 Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University interns from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.
   

  

 As a Technology Specialist Intern, you will engage with and guide customers toward technical decisions to purchase and use Microsoft technology. You will leverage sales strategy to address customer digital transformation and align technology to customer business needs. You will understand customer needs, collects customer feedback, and provides strategic input to customers. You will act as an orchestration point for technical resources and works to resolve blockers in order to achieve solution implementations.
   

  

 At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. You’ll be empowered to build community, explore your passions and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develops understanding of current customer context and anticipates next steps. Uses product expertise to build credibility with customers.
* Reviews customer interactions and raises competitive information to account teams to contribute to development and landing of compete strategies.
* Contributes to product strategy by soliciting and communicating customer feedback.
* Tailors Microsoft standard messaging to audience using knowledge of specific Microsoft products.
* Contributes to demonstrations (e.g., proof of concept [POC] sessions) of solutions based on specific Microsoft products through initial engagements and coaching from senior colleagues. Leverages partner/customer teams as needed to prove product capabilities and integration into customer environment.
* Consumes and leverages readiness materials to expand domain knowledge and practices expertise by communicating with customers, partners, and senior colleagues.


**Qualifications**
**Required Qualifications:**
* Currently pursuing a Bachelor's, Master's or PhD degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field


 or Must have at least one additional quarter/semester of school remaining following the completion of the internship
   

  

* You must be legally authorised to work in Sweden to be eligible for this role. (Legally authorised = has citizenship or has been granted a valid visa or work permit)
* Fluent English.


 #EiP #MCAPSEiP
   

  

 This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.
   

  

 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about
 **requesting accommodations.**

title: Microsoft 365 Specialist
description:
We are looking for an experienced Office 365 Specialist with at least 8 years of experience working in Microsoft 365 environments. The role requires both technical expertise and a user-focused mindset; you should enjoy working closely with the business, supporting users, and contributing to a secure, efficient, and modern digital workplace.
 



  





**Main tasks** 



* Management and further development of the Microsoft 365 platform.
* Troubleshooting and administration of Teams, SharePoint Online, Exchange Online, OneDrive.
* Support for users and operations: consulting, training, advanced support and problem solving.
* Documentation, development of guidelines, and further development of governance models.
* Participates in and drives projects, assignments and initiatives within the modern workplace, security and platform optimization.
* Incident, problem and change management.
* Drive improvements, identify optimizations, and contribute to more efficient working methods.



  





**Experience and competence requirements** 




**Technical expertise** 



* At least 8 years of experience with Microsoft 365/Office 365 in larger and complex environments.
* Deep expertise in:
* Microsoft Teams
* SharePoint Online
* Exchange Online
* OneDrive for Business
* Microsoft 365 Defender
* Microsoft Azure EntraID
* Azure Functions, Logic Apps, Automation Services
* PowerShell for administration and automation.



  





**Good experience in:** 



* Understanding identity and access, Conditional Access, and Zero Trust.
* Email flows and related processes
* Ability to collect and analyze information and evidence during incidents.
* Collaboration with cybersecurity teams and SOC at a mid-sized company.
* Good experience with Microsoft Purview:
* Sensitivity labels / Information Protection
* Data Loss Prevention
* eDiscovery
* Retention
* Compliance Manager
* Opportunity to contribute to the organization's data protection and compliance work.



  





**Meritorious – Experience with IT security tools** 



* Experience with modern IT security solutions is a plus, as the role collaborates with security and compliance functions. Examples of solutions:
* Mimecast
* Darktrace
* Or other security tools.



  





**Working closely with people and user support** 




 You like to work closely with users and businesses, preferably in roles that include consulting, training, anchoring, and renewal of new working methods.
 



 Enjoy helping others create/improve user experiences.
 



 You are part of a team of colleagues who deliver both platform services and a comprehensive solution for our 1,500 colleagues.
 



  





**Personal characteristics** 



* Service-oriented, educational, and good at explaining technology in an understandable way.
* Structured, analytical, and self-driven.
* Proactive and solution oriented.
* Enjoys collaborating and being part of a group but also developing relationships both in the team and with the business.



  





**Training** 




 Post-secondary education in IT or equivalent work experience.
 



  





**Language** 




 Very good Swedish and English, spoken and written.
 



 The team consists of 13 people who are responsible for the customer's entire IT operations and delivery of services to their business and offices in Sweden. Here you get great freedom and clear responsibility. You also get support, advice, and guidance.
 



  





 Ready for your next career move? Explore opportunities at Co-Workertech.com
 



 Join our LinkedIn groups for updates on upcoming opportunities! Connect, collaborate, and thrive with industry leaders:
 


* Co-Worker Technology
* Co-Worker Renewable Energy Industry Jobs
* Follow us to stay updated on the latest news, insights, and exciting announcements from our company.

title: Consulting Associate Director- Cloud Transformation
description:
At
 **Gartner Consulting** 
 , we don't just advise; we equip leaders with
 **objective, data-driven insights** 
 from our unparalleled research and advisory business. As an Associate Director, you will lead complex cloud transformations, leveraging our proprietary frameworks and
 **unique access to enterprise data and analyst expertise** 
 to help clients make the right technology choices and achieve measurable business outcomes. You will leverage your understanding of cloud architectures and emerging technologies to shape transformation journeys, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and industry best practices.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Strategic Cloud Advisory: Partner with senior stakeholders to define cloud vision, strategy, and transformation roadmaps that support business growth, agility, and resilience.
* Cloud Value Realization: Identify opportunities for cost optimization, scalability, and competitive differentiation through effective cloud utilization and modernization.
* Transformation Leadership: Lead cloud readiness assessments, business case development, and executive workshops to build consensus and drive change across business and IT functions.
* Program Oversight: Manage cloud transformation initiatives, ensuring alignment with governance, security, compliance, and financial management standards.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Communicate complex cloud concepts in clear, business-focused language to facilitate decision-making and cross-functional collaboration.
* Continuous Improvement: Monitor cloud adoption metrics, provide actionable insights, and foster a culture of innovation and continuous learning.


**Required Experience & Skills:**
* Fluent in both Swedish & English
* Demonstrated experience in management consulting, digital transformation, or cloud strategy roles.
* Ability to translate business requirements into actionable cloud strategies and solutions, leveraging knowledge of service and deployment models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS; public, private, hybrid).
* Familiarity with major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their strategic capabilities, as well as the current trends and best practices.
* Understanding of cloud governance, security, compliance, and risk management principles.
* Experience leading cloud projects using Agile methodologies, ensuring timely delivery and adaptability to evolving client needs.
* Exceptional communication skills, with a track record of engaging and influencing senior stakeholders.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience with cloud reference architectures, cloud landing zones, and modern application delivery models (containerization, serverless, microservices).
* Knowledge of data integration and migration strategies to support seamless transformation.
* Relevant cloud certifications are advantageous but not mandatory.


**Why Join Us?**
* Work with the World's Best Data: Gain unmatched access to Gartner's proprietary research, data, and a network of 2,000+ industry analysts. You'll deliver advice that is objective, actionable, and backed by the most comprehensive IT data in the world and in collaboration with a team of forward-thinking consultants in a dynamic, growth-oriented environment.
* Focus on the Right Advice, Not the Next Project: Unlike traditional consulting, our model prioritizes client success over project duration. Your goal is to provide unbiased, impactful advice, not to prolong engagements.
* Unrivalled Professional Development: Our internal knowledge sharing, direct access to analysts, and dedicated training programs ensure you're always at the forefront of cloud trends.


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective business and technology insights, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our vast, virtually untapped market potential offers limitless opportunities – opportunities that may not even exist right now – for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:100847
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Cloud Architect who loves mentoring and leading? Come and play!
description:
Finding a Cloud Architect who actually enjoys the human side of tech is a bit like finding a unicorn that also knows how to (and
 *wants* 
 to!) lead the herd. You need the high-level vision to design the map, as well as the willingness to pick up a compass and lead the way through the skies.
 



 At some companies, "Architect" is a title for someone who sits in an ivory tower and hands down diagrams from on high. That’s not us.
 



 We’re looking for a Cloud Architect who loves mentoring and leading someone who still gets a buzz from opening an IDE and showing the team how it's done.
 



 You are the vital link between big-picture business strategy and the daily "how-to." You aren't just designing the blueprint; you’re on-site with the crew, translating complex business needs into actionable features and sprints.
 




**The 75/25 Split (Give or Take)** 


  



 We believe the best leaders are those who stay sharp. You can expect a minimum of 50% hands-on engineering work. Not because you "need" to, beacause you actually want to.
 



* The Easy Days: You’re building, deploying, and mentoring.


* The "Consultancy" Days: Some clients need a bit more hand-holding. When the going gets tough, you might shift to a 50/50 split, balancing deep-dive engineering with stakeholder coordination and expectation management.


 What you'll do
 * Driving the Ship: This isn't an administrative role. You are a Team Lead in every sense; guiding project delivery from concept to "it's alive!"
* Translating "Tech" to "Human": You’ll be chatting with Directors and Engineering Managers one hour, and pair-programming with a dev the next. You need to speak both languages fluently
* Managing the Vibe: You know how to manage people and expectations in a clear, friendly and inclusve manner. We value autonomy, proactivity, and, most importantly, being someone people actually enjoy working with


 Who are you?
 
 Tech has probably been a vital form of interest in your life, and you might have started out tinkering with games, or solving problems by creating technical solutions, or maybe just had that mind-set sayin "I want to to know how and why it works!".
 



 You might have started of your career in sw development, system engineering or as DevOps and somewhere along the way you also learned that you have an interest in leading/mentoring people.
 



 You would probably describe yourself as:
 




**Technically Senior:** 
 You’ve been around the cloud block. You have the seniority to back up your decisions and the competence to earn the team's respect
 





**Project-Driven:** 
 You’ve got a track record of driving projects across the finish line, not just riding in the passenger seat
 





**A Proactive Type:** 
 You don’t wait for a ticket to tell you something is broken. You see a gap, you fill it
 








**Tech Skills:** 



* Architectural-level competence required in at least one of the three hyperscalers: AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform


* Infrastructure as Code


* CI/CD experience with automated code deployment


* C
 
 ontainer orchestration


* Observability tools


* Configuration management



**Bonus:** 





 Development experience in languages like Go or Python is beneficial for understanding developer experience, automation, and infrastructure as code
 




**Buzzword bingo:** 




 AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Terraform, Pulumi, SDK, ArgoCD, GitHub Actions, Kubernetes, Grafana, Datadog, CloudWatch, Ansible, Go, Python, Docker
 


 Language requirement
 
 Fluency in Swedish is a very-nice-to-have and English is a must. Why? Because
 *most* 
 of our collaborations and client projects are conducted in Swedish
 






 Welcome to Playground!
 
 At Playground, you work on real, complex assignments for well-established and ambitious clients, not bench projects or short-lived experiments. Our teams are trusted with production systems, platforms, and data that actually matter. Here growth comes from ownership, curiosity, and doing the work properly. You’re trusted to think, contribute, and keep getting better, one meaningful step at a time.
 



 Playground brings together specialized domains under one umbrella, with a shared culture and way of working, and easy access to broad technical expertise when it helps move the work forward.
 











 Buzz: Product Development, PO, SRE, Site Reliability Engineer, Team Lead, Consultant, Konsult, Data Engineer, Systemutvecklare, SW Engineer, Backend Developer, DevOps, Sverige, Stockholm, Amazon Web Services, SW Architecture, Cloud Lead

title: Test Automation Engineer
description:
*Vill du kvalitetssäkra framtidens datadrivna lösningar i en modern molnplattform? Som Test Automation Engineer på Skandia blir du en nyckelperson i ett team med 100 % testautomatisering och snabba releaser.*
*Hos oss blir du en del av en kultur präglad av samverkan, nyfikenhet och framtidstro, där vi satsar på datadriven innovation och moderna molnlösningar – och där du är med och driver utvecklingen framåt.*
**Om rollen**
 Som Test Automation Engineer blir du en viktig del i utvecklingen och kvalitetssäkringen av Skandias molnbaserade informationsplattform YoDA, en central del av vår datadrivna framtid byggd på Azure och Snowflake.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett tvärfunktionellt team på cirka 10 personer (Product Owner, Scrum Master, Business Analyst, QA och data warehouse-utvecklare) och arbetar enligt standardiserade, ständigt förbättrade processer. Test är fullt automatiserat för att möjliggöra snabba och kvalitetssäkrade releaser.
   

  

**Du Kommer Att**
* Analysera, designa, utveckla och exekvera tester
* Arbeta med testautomatisering i data warehouse-plattformen YoDA
* Utveckla och förbättra vårt automatiserade testramverk (X-Automate och Robot Framework)
* Föreslå och implementera förbättringar i teststrategier och processer
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam enligt SAFe®
* Dela kunskap och bidra till kompetensutveckling inom test


 Vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsmodell med kombination av kontor och distansarbete.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen söker vi dig som:**
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i SQL
* Är analytisk, kreativ, ansvarstagande och har god samarbetsförmåga
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska
* Har minst 6 års erfarenhet av testautomatisering inom data warehouse
* Har relevant akademisk examen
* Har erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av rollen som Scrum Master


**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi arbetar med löpande urval, så skicka gärna in din ansökan redan idag.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning för att säkerställa en rättvis och objektiv bedömning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Fredrik Othberg på fredrik.othbergt@skandia.se
   

  

  

  

 Vi återkopplar till alla som söker, oavsett om du går vidare i processen eller inte.
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Head of Platforms and Core Services
description:
**Head of Platforms & Core Services**
**Location:** 
 Vingcard – ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions
   

  

**Industry:** 
 Access Solutions & Connected Technologies
   

  

 At ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions, part of the global ASSA ABLOY Group, we imagine new ways people move through a safer, more open world every single day. From automatic doors and hotel locks to border control solutions — chances are, you’ve already used our technology without even realizing it. With operations in over 70 countries and more than 52,000 colleagues worldwide, we lead the way in secure, seamless access experiences.
   

  

 Within our Vingcard business, we now have an exceptional opportunity for an experienced technology leader to join us as
 **Head of Platforms & Core Services** 
 .
   

  

**Your Impact**
 As Head of Platforms & Core Services, you will play a pivotal role in building, shaping, and governing the shared technology platforms that power all product units across our portfolio. Reporting directly to the CTO, you define the platform vision that enables scale, accelerates product innovation, ensures interoperability, and supports the integration of acquired businesses.
   

  

 You will architect the foundations—platforms, data, integration frameworks, security principles—that allow our teams to move faster, integrate effectively, and deliver a coherent ecosystem to customers around the world.
   

  

 This is a deeply technical, architecture‑led leadership role at the center of a global enterprise that continues to grow through innovation and acquisition.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities** 
**Platform & Architecture Leadership**
* Define and evolve the enterprise platform strategy across cloud, data, integration, and shared services.
* Own reference architectures, architectural standards, and governing technical principles across product domains.
* Act as senior solution architect for complex cross‑brand or cross‑product initiatives.
* Ensure platform decisions balance scalability, security, resilience, and long‑term maintainability.


**Business Integration & M&A Technology Roadmaps** 
  

  

* Own the technology integration strategy for acquired companies.
* Build and maintain rolling technology roadmaps covering:
+ Platform migration of acquired products and teams
+ Decommissioning of legacy systems

* Contribute to technical due diligence for future acquisitions.
* Establish repeatable integration patterns to accelerate M&A activity.


**Integration & Interoperability**
* Own API, middleware, and event‑driven integration standards.
* Enable seamless interoperability across product units and with hotel ecosystems (PMS, BMS, GRMS, and third‑party systems).
* Govern integration frameworks to ensure a coherent, unified solution landscape.


**Data, Analytics & Intelligence Enablement**
* Own shared data platforms, pipelines, and foundational analytics infrastructure.
* Enable AI, predictive analytics, and data‑driven innovation through robust governance.
* Ensure data quality, consistency, and appropriate access controls across domains.


**Security, Compliance & Technical Governance**
* Own security architecture, identity frameworks, and access management principles.
* Define and drive secure‑by‑design and privacy‑by‑design standards.
* Lead technical compliance programs (ISO, SOC, GDPR) with security and legal partners.
* Contribute to architecture and governance forums across the enterprise.


**Skills & Experience**
 You bring:
   

  

* Senior leadership experience in platform architecture, distributed systems, and integration‑heavy environments.
* A proven track record steering large‑scale system integration and platform consolidation programs.
* Deep expertise in cloud‑native architectures, data platforms, and API‑led ecosystems.
* Experience integrating acquired businesses into shared enterprise platforms.
* Strong understanding of security architecture, governance, and compliance frameworks in complex B2B settings.
* Natural authority and credibility with senior engineers, architects, and technical leaders.
* Ability to influence effectively across a matrix organization without direct line management.


**Leadership Attributes**
* Systems thinker with long‑term architectural vision
* Pragmatic, outcome‑oriented decision‑maker
* Technically credible, calm, and authoritative
* Able to balance product team autonomy with enterprise coherence
* Strong communicator in complex cross‑functional environments


**What You Can Expect From Us**
* A competitive and comprehensive total rewards package
* Career development resources designed to help you grow and advance
* Supportive, accessible leadership and a values‑driven culture
* The impact and reach of an innovative, global industry leader
* The opportunity to shape the future of secure digital access worldwide


**Application**
 Interested candidates can apply by clicking
 **Apply Now** 
 .
   

  

 Please note: we can only consider applications submitted through the online application system.
   

  

**About ASSA ABLOY**
 ASSA ABLOY has been listed four times among Forbes’ World’s Most Innovative Companies . We create safe, convenient, and intelligent access solutions that bring real value to our customers. Our technologies support billions of people in experiencing a more open world every day. With leading market positions across Europe, the Americas, Asia, and Oceania, our solutions span the entire spectrum of entrance and access requirements — from locks and doors to advanced automation and digital access ecosystems.
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Supporttekniker
description:
Har du arbetat något/några år i en servicedesk, som onsite-tekniker eller IT-tekniker ? Vi på Nexer Infrastructure i Stockholm söker nu fler konsulter som är sugna på att fördjupa sina kunskaper samt utvecklas inom IT. Hos oss får chansen att arbeta hos välkända bolag i Stockholmsområdet.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Trygga anställningsvillkor och en fast månadslön
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter som konsult och en långsiktig plan hos Nexer
* En familjär atmosfär och teambuildingaktiviteter med dina Nexer-kollegor


**Om tjänsten**
 Som konsult inom IT-support arbetar du brett inom IT och användarstöd, och mer specifikt mot ramverk och verktyg så som Active Directory, Windows OS, Microsoft 365, grundläggande nätverksteknologier och ärendehanteringssystem såsom ServiceNow med flera. De flesta uppdragen innebär att du hjälper någon av våra kunder med IT-support på klientsidan och supporterar internt anställda genom telefon, mail, chatt och ärendehanteringssystem. I vissa uppdrag kan även onsite-support förekomma samt hårdvarusupport för datorer, kringutrustning, skrivare och AV utrustning.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du**
* Har minst ett års erfarenhet av arbete i servicedesk/first line support
* Motiveras av att lösa problem och lämna användaren med ett leende på läpparna
* Trivs i att bemöta människor och ge stöttning på ett pedagogiskt sätt
* Har obehindrade kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift


 Vi ser gärna att du är bekant med följande tekniker: Active Directory, Windows OS, Microsoft 365/Azure, Windows Remote Desktop, SCCM/Intune, arbete i ärendehanteringssystem samt grundläggande kunskap inom felsökning av nätverk. Det är också ett plus om du har supporterat Mac klienter tidigare.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen som konsult hos oss tror vi att du har god analytisk förmåga, tar initiativ och är ihärdig när det gäller felsökning och problemlösning. Vi tror även att du har god samarbetsförmåga och trivs med att arbeta både individuellt och i grupp, eftersom du som konsult kan komma att arbeta i olika sammanhang.
   

  

**Mer om Nexer Infrastructure**
 Nexer Infrastructure (vi hette då Sigma IT Tech) startade sin verksamhet 2018 och är specialister på en sak – talanger inom drift, support och IT-infrastruktur. Vi hjälper företag att växa och framtids säkra sin kompetens med hjälp av flexibla konsulttjänster. Bland våra kunder finns många välkända aktörer som är marknadsledande inom sina respektive branscher.
   

  

 Som IT- konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och vi är måna om att du ska trivas. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att upprätthålla den goda stämningen i vår grupp, bland annat genom gemensamma aktiviteter som föreläsningar, after works och gemensamma lunch träffar. Blir du konsult hos oss lyssnar vi till dig, dina behov och i vilken riktning du vill utvecklas.
   

  

  

  

**Ansökan** 
  

  

 Då urval sker löpande ser vi gärna att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att läsa den!

title: Information Security Officer
description:
**About Anyfin**
 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to challenge the status quo, lowering interest rates, removing unnecessary fees, and helping people take control of their finances. With more than a million app downloads across Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Germany, we've helped hundreds of thousands of people save money.
   

  

 We recently obtained our banking license, which means new opportunities and new responsibilities. We're looking for someone to own security and help us meet regulatory requirements (including DORA) without drowning in bureaucracy.
   

  

**Your mission**
 This is a hands-on generalist role where you’ll own Anyfin’s security posture across governance, technical security, and operations. But you won’t do it in isolation, you’ll have support from legal, compliance, and engineering. Your job is to coordinate, drive, and make sure things actually happen.
   

  

 Some areas require your depth (security governance, technical security practices). Other areas require you to coordinate and oversee (incident response, vendor security, training). We’re looking for someone who’s comfortable with that mix and pragmatic about where to focus.
   

  

 This is
 **not** 
 a “build a security empire” role. It’s roll-up-your-sleeves work: drafting policies that make sense, running access reviews, helping out in GCP, and making sure we’re genuinely secure and not just compliant on paper.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 Security is a top priority for Anyfin right now, not “someday”. With a banking license in place and new regulatory requirements (including DORA), this role will be central to making sure we scale in a secure, resilient, and pragmatic way.
   

  

 You’ll own and drive the full security agenda across three core areas:
   

  

* Governance & compliance (done pragmatically)


 You’ll Make Sure We Have The Right Foundations In Place Such As Policies, Routines, Documentation, And Reporting Without Creating Unnecessary Overhead. This Includes
   

  

* Drafting and maintaining security policies, instructions, and routines that meet both operational and regulatory requirements
* Internal and external reporting
* Staying on top of DORA and relevant frameworks (with support from legal/compliance)
* Maintaining the Registry of Information and supporting risk assessments, including NPAP
* Preparing for and following up on audits
* Technical security (not just compliance on paper)
